content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Note: My play time on Steam is NOT what I determined this review with. I played before it came to Steam.First off my guild(The Oran'Thul) was personally contacted by the devs of Echo of Soul to test the game. This is an unbiased, truthful review of the game.Let me start by saying I plan to give this game a negative review. Now that's not saying its terrible and its not worth playing, but for those who take their MMOs seriously and competitively, you are going to want to steer clear of this one.Echo of Soul at its core is a pretty decent MMO, entertaining pve and pvp. It does not stand out from the rest of the MMO's but for the features it does have, it does do them pretty well.The MAJOR issues that this game suffers from is pretty much what plagues every other MMO that has been released for the past few years.1. PAY TO WIN.This is a MAJOR issue for those who wish to play MMOs competitively and take their MMOs seriously. This game comes from Aeria games, for those of you who have played their games before you most likely are not surprised to hear that this game is P2W.2. BALANCE ISSUES.My god.....my guild and I looked past the pay to win issue in this game and said "meh its an MMO to kill time with". When we got into the battlegrounds....  the balance...MY GOD THE BALANCE!!!!The issue became apparent when we were still low levels, so we brushed it off as a balance issue at lower level pvp. As we leveled the issue became much...MUCH worse.There are currently 5 classes in the game, 3 are nearly unplayable vs the other 2. Can you guess who the underpowered ones are? As always, its the melee. The sorceress and the Archer are disgustingly overpowered to the point that you shouldn't even bother pvping at all as a melee.3. CHANNEL SYSTEMThe channel system...the bane on all open world MMOs. For those of you who dont know what a channel system is....here is a quick explanation.A channel system is pretty much a way to take one server and break it up into a ton of mini servers. This allows the developers to spread out a congested world so players arent overcrowding everything to the point that there are no mobs to kill and you cant move an inch without being ganked. There is a right way, and a wrong way to implement a system like this. Echo of Soul does it the wrong way.As you progress through the game you are constantly entering little instance portals, this hurts the game as you get the feeling that the world is not an open worlds, its just a bunch of mini instances smashed together with load screens between each of them. When you enter these portals you are thrown into a random channel of that specific zone.For instance...FOREST ZONE (CHANNEL 2) --> CAVE ZONE (CHANNEL 4)As you can see above, when you progress from one zone to another you are thrown into a random channel. This may be packed full of players, or have none at all.This really destroys the feeling of being in an open, growing world filled with players.In addition this absolutely KILLS world pvp. My guild and I found it nearly impossible to join a friend in a channel to participate in world pvp becuase the channel was filled.Lastely this also allows players to leave the channel to run away from potential pvp.This truly makes for a babies MMO and anyone serious about their MMOs should stay away.-------------------------------------------------------Some cash shop items.-------------------------------------------------------Instant ressing on spot.4% attack damage buff4% defense buff30% increased pvp currencymounts that have a lower chance to be knocked off of when received damage.amnesia = respec (you only get ONE for free....ONE)EXP AND GOLD GAIN DOUBLED FOR 24 HOURS.Digestant = Allows you to use an incredible amount of rediculously powerful food buffs.Appraisers Pouch = Reroll stats on a piece of gear to obtain the one that suits you best.AND THE WORST MOST PAY TO WIN CRAP IN THE GAMESAFEGUARD = PREVENTS A JEWEL FROM BEING DESTROYED WHEN ENHANCEMENT FAILS. - This right here.And in Addition...ENHANCEMENT BOOSTER = INCREASE THE CHANCE FOR A SUCCESFULL ENHANCEMENT.Jewels are single BEST way to increase your gear. You know those MMOs where you can increase a piece of gear from +1 to +5 without failing then anything from +6 to +9 has a chance to downgrade then anything above +9 has a chance to break the piece of gear?Well these jewels are that in a nutshell. A player with +10 gems in every slot can easily kill 5 players at the same time if those players have no gems.If you continue to use this item and shovel heaps and heaps of money into the cash shop. YOU. WILL. BECOME. A. GOD. It may take you $1000, or maybe $2000, but if you throw enough money at this game YOU WILL BE UNTOUCHABLE.Here, enjoy some links.http://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/92659e831f6a71673aaff2e483503276/files/eos/image/F/FarmpackEN.jpghttp://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/c4d3f6851764005cc00e8f558f711bb6/files/eos/image/2/2-Safe-23.jpghttp://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/388506da8cdc0bf28698113eee760cb3/files/eos/image/1/10-EN1-230.jpghttp://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/3a9742e1df1c8bcfe89e4e9225c2cc76/files/eos/image/p/pvppackhero.jpghttp://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/5e5fe0eed44ce71da5e09675f95a3355/files/eos/image/4/401-AppraisersPouch50WM.jpghttp://cms-content.s.aeriastatic.com/d4924c57c4fcc6da8c3fb528e42e4b7a/files/eos/image/1/101-Amnesia.jpgSource: Their cash shop page: http://echoofsoul.aeriagames.com/itemmall/FeaturedAll in all, its not too bad for casual MMO players.I give it a MEH out of a possible BON QUISLO

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												I would like to start by saying I havn't tried the PvP side of the game and doubt i will, its just not my thing so I will leave that for people that play that way to comment on that side of things, so that said i will comment on the PVE side which is the way I play my main MMo's (WoW, FFXI, FFXIV and Rift).I've found this nice fun, easy to play and learn, although im not through to end game content yet Im still questing through and leveling my mage I am finding it nicely paced and not too rushed. If you play other mmo's ou'll find the quests are of the usual variety collect X of this, kill Y of those monsters, one feature i do like and wish a few others would pick up and incorperate into thier games is that not only do the quests show on the mini map each quest has a little arrow and distance marker beside it showing where to go and how far it is, nice touch thanks, quest text is clear and easily readable and understandable and also conveys the game lore without it being bashed over your head with it.The single player dungeons are also a nice touch aswell, it gives you  the chance run off do a dungeon without having to hang around either waiting for a group finder to get a group for you or you tring to PUG a group, the instances are not insainely difficault and can be done with quest dropped items and also give good rewards without spending ages to finish   there are some simple tactics to each boss which are easy to pick up and learn, and the usual rule applies "Dont stand in the Fire".To the big question being as it is free to play is it pay to win?   As far as PVE goes not really, you can get boosts and safegaurds to your crafting and things of that fayre but most of the pay for items I've seen so far are vanaty Items and these can be perchased in game from merchants with gold and silver anyway.Conclusion...Would i recommend this game to other people? Yes, it makes an ideal starter MMo for people comming into the genre its not overly complicated and everything is explained for you, its not as "grindy" as some i could mention and has a nice pace to it. It does not have the cutting edge graphics that some of the latest MMo's have so can be played on an average  PC or Laptop which is no bad thing, not everyone can afford a top end gaming rig. For an experienced MMo player like myself i found it a nice change, everone one i've spoken to in game has been friendly and helpfull which is nice and bodes well for the in game community as a whole. While this will never replace my main MMo's its also not going to be left out either.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												I definitely recommend this game!As a ex-hardcore wow player, I would like to share my thoughts on this game as well.I played this game as a rogue through CBT and the OBT!Let me give you an honest feedback about this game1. Creating a character is a little bit weird since you have  gender locked  classes. Beside that: The options to customize your character are really nice! I'm very happy with the way my char looks!2. Graphics: The game will not deliver the best graphics in history but its decent for a f2p. Not everybody can afford to have a BiS computer. It can reach a wider audience and attracts more players.3. First Steps: The game basically supports you in every possible way.  Quests to introduce the dungeon browser, pvp browser and so on. 4. Questing: Of course its the usual Search X and deliver it to Y, Kill X amount of Y but there are other quests as well. I'm not positively surprised but also not disappointed. 5. PvP: You can clearly feel, that the game is made for Characters who reached level 60. You can join the pvp battle as soon as you hit level 10 (with an outstanding matchmaking system) and you most likely get owned by people who have a higher level than you. You resistance and HP are pumped up to level 60 standard but you can obviously not compete with your level 10 gear and skillset. Nevertheless, I was able to get the mvp (best player in the team) a lot of times when i was between level 10 and 40. The PvP is not necessarily innovative but it gives a ton of xp, and is really fun. Even though you are a melee and not level 60.I also dont get why people complain about (always the same). They took the best content of other games and implemented it here. Its a nice combination of my favourite MMOS.6. PvE: I really really like the Single Dungeon System and the grouping is amazing as well. You can match groups or go alone. One criticism: The leader can just kick people for whatever reason. If you dont have the super awesome gear, you get kicked in most of the times. On the other hand: It helps a lot to not wipe infinitely and if you dont have good gear, get some. There are tons of ways to farm good stuff in the game and i dont speak about cashing in.7. p2w?: Yes and No! Of course, this is a f2p title and some paid features give you some kind of advantage. I think, Aeria wants to make things different here and when I compare this Launch to Aura Kingdom back in the days, I can clearly say, that this here is totally different. I never had the feeling that I have to spend money. Questing was always flawless, never an artificial blocker which annoyed me or forced me to buy an xp boost. There are tons of free events which give me some nice goodies. Im pretty okay with the fact that people who spend money get some benefits since they are keeping the service alive!Summary: There are pros and cons but eventually the game is a lot of fun to play, even without paying!The game is not really "free". Paying users get some benefits but they dont have an impact on the fairness in game. You can achieve everything without paying in a reasonable time. Its just like a p2p mmo but paying users get a small advantage. Pretty fair imo.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												Liked:-Simple, UI pretty easy to navigate-Tutorial wasn't overbearing, things are explained decently-Outfits/gear peices were cute without being overly nude-Gems are per slot. Emerald? Goes in belt slot and so on. -Log in bonus, gives some interesting stuff. XP buff for 7 days, other varies things from the cash shop/found in-game.-End of the first 7 days logging in every day get a faster then "generic" mount. Means EVERYONE gets it, not who spent cash.-Classes are pretty basic with "talents and a path" to chose from.-Not overly complex coming from class/talent choices. Makes for easier understanding.-Every class gets a dodge/teleport out of AOE/trouble usuable on a short cooldown.-You can be farely close to a mob without aggroing it, making it easy to travel from location to location-Emotes are unique with some thought placed into their animations-If you get a quest you need to kill 4 monkeys, you kill the first monkey and the marker will move to the next "Monkey" so you're not easily lost questing-In big quest hub/major city there is a quest guy who will send you to your next questing location via a map teleport, if you're ever lost.-PVP is kind of fun, normally not my kind of thing but for a game with no healers, it makes for a stand your ground type thing.Dislike-Profession system isn't clearly explained-Gender Locking-The Voice Acting, what little there was.-Some of the story feels a bit scattered, all over the place-The Cash Shop doesn't really have a whole lot in it, no dangly carrot to make me WANT to spend money...just two quests kind of introducing the Cash Shop (If you're interested in doing them, you need to drop cash or you can easily ignore the two quests)-It can be poorly optimized in areas-Graphics are pretty but lacking in feeling-Quest text can easily be ignored by pressing F (The function with everything in-game Key) and opening the map to find the number you need/are working on.-The "eating/food" buff has NO explanation, it's kind of a stumbled upon fact.-PVP maps not explained, just dumped in.-Incredibly tiny player base.Overall, I'd recommend this as a fun little game. I am not a big supporter on the publisher they chose to go with, but the game is fun. It's got some seriously good potential if the developers take the time and put some serious polish on it. I can't say it's better then anything, the game is very generic and lacks the oomph needed to get it out there with other major MMORPG contenders, but for a niche random choice, it's decent.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												How to begin with Echo of Soul...I suppose to begin, I'm gong to give my rating on this game:  8/10 (reserving judgment due to the status of the game being Open Beta) => RECOMMENDEDI've had a bit of a love-hate relationship with Aeria Games since I first became a member in 2008.  Echo of Soul is the third of their published games which I've played for more than 2 days.  In fact, I've been playing this game since their Open Beta launch on June 1st.  But this isn't about my history with others of Aeria's games, this review is about this one in particular.  Let's begin, shall we?=====CHARACTER CREATION=====The first thing you'll notice about Echo of Soul is that there are a total of five classes (thus far) to choose from.  These classes are gender-locked, and each class has two spec mastery paths.  The gender lock is there to follow with the game's storyline.  The classes you can choose from are as follows:1.  Male Warrior2.  Male Rogue3.  Female Guardian (Lancer, for those familiar with Tera)4.  Female Mage5.  Female ArcherAs you will begin to notice, there is no dedicated healing class.  More on this later.Each class has different customization options available to further make your character unique in physical appearance.  You then start off with a default costume (I can assume this to be random from a small pool, as I've created different characters of the same class, and ended up with differing clothing looks from the get-go.)=====LEVELING=====Leveling in Echo of Soul is very much geared toward the casual player.  For the hardcore speedlevelers, it's possible to make it from levels 1 to 60 (current cap, at time of review) in a matter of 1-3 days through the game's PvP Battlegrounds (accessible starting at level 10.)  For the more casual player, you can still make it to 60 relatively quickly or you can take your time with it.  Moderate-speed casual players can make it inside of a week.  Slow casuals can make it to cap in abotu 2 weeks of gameplay time.Both PvP and PvE Questing offer a very generous amount of EXP, so reaching cap is entirely on how you want to do it.  You can go solely as a Battlegrounds resident, through the PvE story, or mix it up a bit.  For the best leveling experience, I would recommend doing either PvP or PvE (depending on which one you want to stick to primarily) just to try it out.Grinding mobs in the overworld will provide very little in the way of EXP.  Grinding overworld mobs is an easy option to obtain enhancement jewels, crafting ingredients, or even some crafting recipes.  If you wish to do PvE grind for EXP, then your best bet would be to do so in the dungeons.  Though, grinding out the dungeons might not be a bad idea, as the sub and main bosses can provide your character with class-specific equipment sets to further enhance your stats and abilities.  There is also the option to take repeatables in maps called Infinite Hunting Grounds which also reward a fair amount of EXP per turn-in.=====ECONOMY=====There are a couple of things which new players will find out relatively quickly:1.  Mobs do not drop money.2.  Items from NPC vendors are really cheap.This means it will be relatively difficult to make solid gold before your 50-60 level bracket.  I would assume it to be a tactic by the developers to maintain a relatively strong pre-endgame economy.  With that being said, there is no restrictions on the amount of in-game gold you can carry in difference to those at level cap.  If you wish to make some quick major gold for your earlier levels, your best bet would be to utilize the cash shop and in-game auction board.As I have not hit level cap, as of yet (I'm a -very- slow player, and have taken more time to get to know the forum community due to my work/sleep schedules) I will not post a comment on endgame economy.=====QUESTING=====PvE questing is quite linear, and very story-based.  While you do get a vast amount of miscellaneous quests (both overworld and dungeon) the magic of PvE questing truly shines with the story-based quests.  As with most typical MMORPGs, you get EXP, money, and the occasional piece of gear to upgrade your set.  However, it's also relatively easy to outlevel some of these quests, but the EXP you gain from some of the lower-level quests is still quite generous.=====Player-versus-Player=====Echo of Soul offers two types of PvP:  Battlegrounds and Open-World Guild vs Guild.  Let's expand, shall we?Currently, there are two Battlegrounds maps (both accessible starting at level 10.)  Both are points-based Capture the Flag-esque types.  One requires teams to capture resources spawned on the map, and the other requires teams to capture and hold towers for as long as possible.  The actual player-kill aspect of these battlegrounds can be quite hectic and fast-paced.  There are also two tiers of Battlegrounds- one for Levels 10-59, and one exclusively for Level 60.Open-World GvG takes place between guilds which have declared themselves to be hostile.  Players in hostile guilds are fair game to be PK'd at any time, anywhere by other hostile guilds' members.  Guildless and Peaceful-alligned guild players do not have to worry about being randomly PK'd while running around the overworld maps.There is also a PvP event (run at least daily) called Valhalla.  Since I have yet to participate in this event, I cannot write a review about it.=====CRAFTING=====Like the rest of the game, crafting is geared toward the more casual player.  Relatively cheap and brainless, it's fairly easy to level both a profession and the two hobby crafting skills available in a short amount of time.  Certain tiers of crafting require certain character levels to be obtained.  Beginner-level crafters can gain most of their supplies directly from their crafting vendor.  However, there does come a time where some mob grinding is required to get higher level base materials.=====UNIQUE FEATURES=====1.  Echo of Soul has a hunger system.  This is determined by two values:  Energy and Satiety.  The higher your current energy level is to your max, certain buffs are applied to your character.  You increase energy by eating foods which are crafted or obtained as quest rewards.  Satiety is how much food you can eat.  With a max value of 1,000 and each piece of food taking up 200 Satiety, this leaves you with a maximum of 5 food waten at a time.  Satiety can be decreased over time, or with the use of a Digestant item.  Energy is depleted through the use of skills.2.  The Soul System:  Through daily rewards or killing of mobs, you can obtain what's called "Chaos Souls."  When purified (either near a purification point, or cooperatively with another player) these souls can grant you charges for temporary buffs.3.  The Cash Shop:  While most free-to-play MMOs out there have a cash shop which is mostly geared to be pay-to-win, Echo of Souls isn't geared that way.  Mostly asthetics or RNG fun, there is literally nothing on the cash shop which you are required to get to advance in the game, or gain a significant advantage.  The things on the shop which seem that way are literally a pay-to-be-lazy mechanic.4.  No Dedicated Healer Class:  The entire party works as a team to heal!=====THE BADS=====1.  There is no general server chat channel.  Primary communication is done at either close-range, through the use of the Loudspeaker items, or on the map-specific Shout channel.  Unless you get yourself into an active guild, or are part of a different chat system (i.e. Teamspeak) prepare to be playing mostly in blisful chat silence towards you.2.  Your other Typicals:  Elitists, gold spammers, and general complaining doomsday naysayers.=====TL;DR=====If you're a casual gamer looking for a casual game which you can level relatively easily without getting too far behind the curve, then Echo of Soul is a good pick for you!

And you get a lock out if your party leaves at the start of the dungeon if they see your gears sucks. I did the completed the first lvl 60 dungeon only ONCE! content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												If I could give sort of a mixed opinion about this game, I would. It's one thing to say this game is bad, but it's not that great either.For the most part, Echo of Soul plays out like your average tab-target MMO where you go around questing, leveling, etc. What separates this game from its other competitors is its focus on its endgame content, which happens at level 60. The entry barrier for getting to 60 is pretty low and you'll find the path to leveling is pretty simple. However, the moment you hit 60, you'll feel like you're starting at level 1 again. You have to grind your way up the gear ladder just to be able to run party dungeons efficiently, and PVP is not exactly a good option entering level 60 due to a number of powerful players.This is all due to the game's inherent jewel system. The idea of jewels was pretty neat when you're introduced to it around level 15. These jewels enhance your stats and can be combined to form stronger jewels, which can be inserted into sockets on your equipment. While the jewels had a chance to break after a certain point, the game gave you a decent amount of jewels as you leveled, so there was always a steady form of progression in the form of jewels and gear. However, this was all thrown out the window and slows to a halt at level 60, mainly due to the game's separation of jewels into two tiers: dull (used from levels 1-59) and lucid (used at level 60). A fresh player will enter level 60 feeling much weaker than before, as the enemies' power suddenly spikes up as you're forced to trudge through this initial stage of endgame and progression slows down considerably.The biggest problem here is time. As you play, you WILL get everything you need, but that depends on how much time you're willing to invest. Without friends or a nice guild helping you out, you're pretty much stuck grinding some boring dungeons until you can get more these lucid jewels for upgrading your character. The cash shop has a few time-savers that more serious players would consider investing into, from safeguards to prevent jewels from breaking when upgrading and pets that can loot items for you. I do recommend trying to play without spending on these premium items, as they're pretty unnecessary if you can play smart and try to be as self-sufficient as possible.Other than my personal gripe with lucid jewels and the beginning of level 60, the PVE gameplay is pretty good. Questing from 1-59 was a breeze for me and once I managed to gather up some gear at level 60, the party dungeons have been fun to run through thanks to the dungeon mechanics keeping players in check. PVP from 1-59 can be pretty fun and has normalized stats to keep it in check, but I suggest staying away from level 60 PVP unless you manage to gather a lot of lucid jewels.If you're looking for a decent F2P MMO like WoW, EoS might be a good game to check out, but I wouldn't recommend it to everyone.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												So Echo of Soul will be my first Review :)Let's start it off with the basics:Classes: There are 5 classes with 2 (3) different roles. There are tanks (Protector and Earthguard), DDs ( Rogue, Mage, Hunter, Berseker and Stormguard) and Supporter (Bard). Yes there is no healer, which gives you the control of your own healthbar. Professions: Haven't looked in to it too much till now but there are primary (resource gathering, alchemy, juwelery) and secondary (soul something and cooking) professions)Control: You use your mouse to target things and move your camera. Your keyboard is for interacting with npcs and using skills. So nothing out of the odinary.Leveling: Leveling is quite easy. You can quick select quests with f, you have a build in questhelper and the first 20-30 Lvls are easily done. The longer you are in the game, the more you must be casious about your skills and need to find a good rotation to progress quickly. Combat: It's a rotation and static based combat system. You cant move while attacking/casting. That being said, the Fights with bosses relies on heavy movement mechanics, which makes things really difficult sometimes. I like that system, it leaves it to you to optimize your dmg output. PvP: 2 PVP maps, 5v5 Arena and Guildbattles at the start of a F2P game? Check! that's actually pretty big and well done.Dungeons: You have lots of solo dungeons (every 10 lvls 1) which gives you the opportunity to equip yourself and have some fun thorugh the leveling process. There are group dungeons too, but mostly for lvl 60 chars. Endgame: This Game has it all: good balanced pvp (no dimishing return right now, i hope they patch that in), lots of dungeon content, tiered equip, lots of dailys and professions to do. It won't get boring!Difficulty: I would say you can compare it easily to Vanilla wow, which was for me the most challenging mmo experience I had so far. Most bosses punishing mistakes quite heavily and you won't get much help through guides because there aren't many out yet. You need to learn everything for yourself and that in an environment which is not forgiving to mistakes. For me it's pretty fun :)New things? when you are ahead in lvl, you can warp yourself to a higher map without the need to walk.Bad things? For not so talented MMO player its pretty hard, very difficult to equip yourself without help in the first tiers. You can be held in Stunlock in PVP forever. Your bags are to small. All the cool looking stuff cost (normal armor looks a bit ♥♥♥♥♥♥)Overall: I would recommend trying it out. When you get past the early 2-3 hours (pls don't hear on reviews from people with such short duration of play. They have no experience and just hate for no reason). It isn't for everyone, but it's F2P so trying it out would be the best choice for you.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												Game ♥♥♥♥ed old players. A good indication that they will ♥♥♥♥ over current players too in the future. Examples:1. Lvl cap increases. By adding maximum levels, the skill tree has expanded. However, the way the skilltree has expanded is ridiculous and impractical. For those that hasn't played EoS, it runs on a skill tree that allows you to choose 2 perks out of 3 for every 5 levels up until your last level, which you can only choose one from. - Instead of adding new skill columns for lvl 65 and lvl 70, they just inserted some into lvl 30s.  This means that you have lost your final class ability, for most classes, is a significant buff that can decide whether you can do a dungeon at lvl 60 or at lvl 70.2. Pay to win. This game was one of the best games 2 years ago. I played it before it came on Steam. Every one would be on equal playing grounds. You could spend no money on this game and be better than the guy that spent 300 dollars buying custom skins, pets, etc. You could get really OP items by grinding for them day and night. And everyone else who wanted that item has only one way to get it: by grinding for it. Now you can pay to have a mount that gives you the same buff as the mount that took someone over 6 monthes to grind for.3. Toxic Community. Now for a game that has PvP implemented into it, toxicness is understandable. It has always existed in battlefields, Valhalla. This does not mean that the game should get to the point where even Game Sages have quit and you are left with a Report button that has not done anything since the start of the game.There are so much more issues that I can address on this game, but just know now, any time that you spend on this game will become nothing once the developers decided that they want more money.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Ok, so my time in this game was VERY short lived. I have played MMO's since before WoW was an idea. I may throw some more time into this game, but I highly doubt it.First off, all classes are genderlocked. So no, you can not choose your gender. Honestly, not a big issue with me as I'm more about the gameplay and content. It was just a drawback from the standpoint I love customization and variety in my appearance, which once again, this game does practically does not have.Second, story seems pretty generic. World is in trouble, gods need you, yadada. No biggy, it's hard to find an original premise for stories these days. But the world itself is pretty cool. GFX aren't the best of 2015, but it's a F2P....no complaints for not having billion dollar budget GFX.The controls and camera are what cut my time short in this game honestly. I can deal with lack of variety, a medoicre story, crappy graphics...but holy crap...Q and E do not strafe and the camera has to be manually turned. Your A and D keys to not turn your character, but strafe instead. All turning requires the mouse and often times you turn the camera but your character will keep running in the direction you were originally running (AKA character doesn't turn with the camera). I spent more time trying to move and target enemies than actually fighting...I think the only other MMO I've played that had that kind of control/camera system MIGHT have been Lineage II, but even it wasn' this bad.Combat, pretty generic point-and-click spam your rotation MMO. I personally like those kinda of combat system, but the camera issues really throw a wrench into this game...All-in-all, I haven't dont anything outside of the little noob area (hell, didn't even finish that) but based on my experience here....this game is far from being any big award winners. Not the best, no the worst...but definitely not worth the time if you're looking for a good consistent MMO.I may re-do this review later, but I feel like I will probably never devote enough time to do the game a fully unbiased review.

content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
												Okay, so I really enjoy this game! It's really fun and the graphics are really pretty! There are a couple cons for this game, though. But I'll make a little list!Con:1. Only five classes to choose from, cannot choose your gender for them. 2 male classes and 3 female2. It's like every other MMO, kill and collect3. Not a lot of armor choices when buying them in the game stores (most other armor is given through different quests)4. Chat is broken, it censors words that arn't even bad. (Ex: I was censored when writing "something" and character names that have a small resemblence to swear words (such as "Shizuo" from Durarara))Other than those few things, I really enjoyed this game! Don't let the cons that I listed stop you from playing. The game is beautiful style-wise and theres quite a bit of customization you can do with your character! Most MMOs just give you four choices of colors for you hair or something like that, but this game has so much more! The community of the game is pretty nice and I haven't had many problems with the other players. I haven't had to level grind at all because the quest lines pretty much go with your current level. If an enemy overpowers you, usually its just because you need to upgrade your armor or repair it. The quests arn't overly time consuming. I never had a quest that made me kill over 10 enemies (most of them are around 3-5 enemies). There is quite a bit to this game and I really enjoy it! I do reccomend that you try it out. Who knows, you might really like it! If your cool with almost any MMO like me, I can assure that you'll like this one.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Rewrote the review, and changed the rating.First off, this game makes...not always sense.For example, make an egg in this game, all you need is seasoning (which magically turns into an egg apparently)To make a hamburger, all you need is bread. You know what my favourite kind of hamburger is? The one without any kind of meat, or lettuce, or sauce, JUST bread. Yummy.Not to mention you can make three kinds of burgers (BBQ, Bacon ...) and they all need only one ingredient - bread.As a person who loves crafting this is bad. You know what else is bad? Get this:There are three professions in this game, of which you can only learn one, and two hobbies of which you can learn both.Two of the professions need resources you can gather in the wild. Guess what the third profession is. Yep, its Resource gathering.So either you become a resource gatherer and can make nothing out of it but sell things, or you become an alchemist or jeweler and can make nothing because you can't gather resources. If they want to create an active, living market, this is NOT the way to do it, and it somewhat cancels out a certain type of freedom, too, if you want to gather and make your own stuff out of it.However, after playing a bit I have to say that, otherwise, the game is quite solid. The fighting is fun, the graphics are slightly above average but are used well, the game feels fluid despite using the good old tab targeting fighting system, and it constantly rewards you and keeps you engaged. It is still somewhat generic, but I rate games based on how fun they are, and...well, I am having fun.How long that will motivate me? I don't know, but for now, I am motivated to play until the first dungeon (apparently Lvl. 35) and, for an MMO these days, that says a lot for me. Will update this as I go along.Edit 1, 23th June 2015: PVP seems pretty well done. I have seen people saying that melee has an extreme disadvantage, but after playing a few matches, I have seen none of that. Of course, I am nowhere near experienced to really say for certain but it seems pretty fair to me for both melee and ranged, and PVP is kinda fun.Edit 2, 29th June 2015: I played the game more, and rolled a new character. They all feel distinctively different which is certainly a good thing. I still recommend this game.Edit 3, 07th July 2015: I think my final verdict on it is that it is certainly a good and fun way to pass time if you don't look for anything deep. Everyone else should stay away, because its very same-y.

Game engine is quite old or not pushed that far.For me this MMO is standard 5/10 and I will recomend it only for people that want to go zen on grinding in this game.

Product received for free
												Echo of Soul looks like a typical Free to Play MMORPG with tab targeting. Looks easy to level up, quests are easy fetch and kill types, Level cap is 70.  If you have not played other MMORPGs, this game would be a good starter game. Has a Login reward system.  Not much multiplayer content till level 70. Free riding mount and pets.The female bodies look a little odd to me, their chest is too narrow while having a much bigger hip area.  You have a large selection of skin coloring, multiple shades of blue, purple, red black, grey. Able to enlarge head and adjust body height and leg height.  Has facial tatoos and odd eyes selection.  Has gender locked classes.It has PVP, but other players say it is horrible.Venture into solo dungeons and take on hordes of enemies as a one-man (or woman) army. Explore party dungeons with your friends and battle exhilarating bosses with Echo of Soul’s unique combat system, emphasizing cooperative healing. Without the need for a dedicated healer, every party member can get in on the action! You can regenerate health while out of combat.  -  Five customizable classes: Warrior, Archer, Rogue, Guardian, and Sorceress. -  Multiple specializations for each class, dramatically altering their style of play. -  No dedicated healing classes, creating more fast-paced and strategic combat. -  Soul System enables the collection of souls from fallen foes to activate buffs, enhance abilities, or craft useful items.for more info:

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												Echo of Soul is one of those games you pick up when you're bored and want to play some anime styled free2play MMO but have already played the well known games like Mabinogi, Maplestory, Aura Kingdom, Elsword, and the like. It's your typical, run of the mill tab target MMO that doesn't require much thinking. And for that it's great, but man the game does get boring rather quickly. Graphics: They're good; not 10/10, but unless you're a big name developer your game isn't going to have 10/10 graphics anyway, and this is the case of Echo of Soul. Character models look alright, though I wish the archer elf model didn't have such huge ears. This is one of my gripes with MMOs anyway that feature elves; why must they always have huge pointy ears? I blame LOTR and other franchises, but that's neither here nor there. As for the game environment, it's alright. Standard MMO fare, nicely modeled but still a bit rough around the edges, but that's to be expected. I will give props to the user interface and the control system though. The UI is very intuitive and easy to understand while the control system is very familiar; plus, the drop system actually makes sense and doesn't act funky when dealing with multiple mobs (unlike Aion, which is incredibly finicky and bulky).Gameplay: As I have said (and so have others), it's a tab-targeting system. Playing as an elf huntress was rather easy; just click and spam skills at enemies, no need to memorize rotation or worry about cooldown times; just click away. I confess though I am not at end game, so maybe this changes when you reach level 60. That said, gameplay is very, very, very basic at this point and I can see why some people might get turned off and not reach end game. It's just pick up quests from one area->kill the monsters/pick up drops->turn into respective NPC->repeat process. Heck, even the map layounts don't change much and are easy to memorize. It turns into one large area with four small areas connected to the side; complete all the side areas, move onto the next, and you're done. Combine that with the questing process and the combat system and you have yourself a game that is so brainless you can play it half asleep - hell, I've done it. Sound: Nothing fancy; moving on. Music is pretty average for this game as well, but I wasn't expecting anything else. Ultimately the game's averageness is its own undoing. Boring combat, repetitive quests and predictable area mapping makes for a painfully mediocre game. I can't think of a game that is just more "there" than this. I also find it hard to recommend. One one hand, not recommending it is not being fair; the game isn't terrible, but recommending it would give it too much credit. Maybe the game is there to sate our hunger for average MMOs, but there are better MMOs out there. But if you played all those MMOs already, there is this.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Its a good game all in all. I haven't played it an exorbtitant amount, but I have had quite a bit of fun with the time I have had. So far the only 2 complaints I have are as follows:1) The sheer number of foreign language speakers on The NA server. Its not that I am against foreign language, but its far past the point where they should have made servers specifically for these other groups, because they aren't exactly a minority group. Its actually starting to cause problems when grouping with other people for dungeons.2) I actually find this one a tad amusing: The censorship system. It censors any words that are specified inappropriate, maybe a little TOO well. Even if the letters are in seperate words, like Four's Excellence, its censors the letters xD As for the pro's to the game, there are quite a few, so I will confine it to 5.1) The music, Oh good grief the music! It is AMAZING, it fits very well, and right off the bat on opening the title menu my first day I felt at home2) The graphics. Now some of you may think "ok, its got good graphics, so what?" but I'm not saying, jacking it up all the way to ultra, even at minimum, which I found to be just as manageable as other MMORPG's, the graphics are stellar. So if you are looking to focus on game performance over graphics quality, you aren't sacrificing a whole lot by running minimum.3) The player base seems to be quite friendly thus far. Although not a whole lot of questions have been answered for me, there are still plent of friendly people I have run into. Dont take that to mean this game has no trolls, every mmo does to some extent, but the people who are friendly go above and beyond ^_^4) The skill paths for classes are quite simple, but it still requires a bit of careful planning to get a suitable combination. 5) The main hub for the first large zone has ALOT to do, and is quite large. I didn't do a whole lot of exploring, but there were quite a few vendors.I hope this has helped to some degree, and if you have any questions that this review failed to answer, please feel free to ask in the comments below ^_^

content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												I am a veteran wow player playing vanilla private servers on and off for 7 years and I just want to say as a elitist mmo♥♥♥♥♥that this is the ONLY anime mmo you will find with endgame. PVP is fun, there are 2 bgs and some 5v5 arena (havent done arena yet). The bgs are really cool and this game is still relatively new so they might add another which I think they should consider. I haven't done much PVE yet but I watched some videos of the raids and they seemed like really long fights that actually required tactics, to say the least I was impressed by the videos I saw. (looks like there is legitimate gear progression as well that makes the pve content last a long time).I have played this for about 13 hours at the time of this post and I have to say it has enough unique elements to make it a little different than a few mmos as far as professions and the soul system. (and combat seeing as there is no dedicated healing class).Kind of like gw2 meets fable meets wow but unlike gw2 it actually has a feeling of progression instead of running around having no idea what your doing. There is an npc in the main town that gives you a quest to go to a level appropriate zone if you outlevel the content you were previously on, which can happen if you run dungeons and do a pvp daily after level 15 that gives a level each day basically. (which I was impressed with).I have yet to do a party dungeon but I am leveling a tank and I have done a few solo dungeons (I am only level 24) and they seemed to be pretty solid and I can start to see how the mechanics work and its really exciting. The numbers aren't too big either which is what I like. The damage output is similar to burning crusade wow atleast from what it looks like. I don't think this game can mess up the system they have very easily so it feels like a good enough investment spending my time here.Much better than other Anime Mmos seeing as Aura Kingdom's level grind is insane and doesn't seem to have endgame whats so ever and Mabinogi is out dated and theres no reason to log on besides troll free loot events.I have been around, played a lot of anime mmo's off and on just as a troll for fun and this one impressed me enough to write a review and I haven't even played it that long. iz pretty cool.

												the game looks nice but thats kinda all it has going for it.character creation: a bit limited. 5 classes, though it is early, more might be added but i couldnt choose gender. few hair styles, colors or faces. though the option to change the pattern in the eyes is cool.camera movement/ wasd: cam keeps resetting after i move it to where i want to look while i move. must stop moving to move cam.cam movement/ mouse: clunky. hit boxes on everything are so big you cant move around without accidentally clicking on an enemy thats behind you.battle system: not bad, choose your attack and wait for it to charge up rather than burst everything and wait for cooldown makes it much more involved and strategic. this♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off; whoever gets last hit on something if youre not in a party will TAKE THE KILL and the quest points involved with said kill. i attacked every one of the type of enemy i needed to kill to progress a story quest for 20 minutes and didnt get the last hit on any so i couldnt progress.General experience: feels like any other mmo, go here do this, go there do that with nothing to do in the meantime but fight or wait. it doesnt matter how big your world is, unless theres something interesting to do while youre moving from quest to quest its just as if everything was brought to me, only i have to wait a few minutes before i can do anything.only played to lvl 6 so i didnt have much experience but its enough to tell me it doesnt stand out from any other of the dozens of mmos ive played before.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2015
												1st things 1st.. the game is "GENDER LOCKED", thought gender locking in mmo'ss went out with the ARK.SO! after spending over two weeks of playing this game and getting to level 60, I RAGE QUITED over the fact that once you hit level 60 the game just becomes stupid and fraking annoying. Unless your a wizard at making gold (game currency) in MMO's i'd stay WELL clear of this game. Here's why...All MP/HP pots/scrolls are 1 silver.. but when you hit level 60, you cant use the potions lower than that level, which means you need to buy the lvl 60 pots/scrolls.. these cost like 300 silver+ just for ONE.. trust me, getting 1 gold in the game would take you a good few quests early on, at top level it's NOT so hard.. BUT here's the thing.. you NEED these items at 60 in dng's.. so, no cash.. no pots/scrolls.. no heals.. no parties want you.. you gold is GONE in hours that took you WEEKS to save up.The only thing possible to do is use the gold sellers, but by doing that you will run the risk of having your account/game hacked, so I would NOT recommend doing that.. I would recommend just staying FAR AWAY from this game.The game itself looks amazing at a lot of the places you go too, though the few starter zones/areas look REALLY BAD! and most people would take one look at it and quit within 20mins of playing, I nearly did, im glad i played on though because even though the gold thing is a MAJOR problem.. the game itself is NOT that bad and I can't knock the rest of the game because of MY issues I have making gold in mmo's... unless I cash-shop items and sell them in the auction or whatever.. I stopped doing that a LONG time ago.The gold, hp/mp pot/scroll cost is an issue that Aeria REALLY needs to sort out but are refusing too.. this is the WORSE game in their catalogue of mmos by far, and I know because I've played all the games they offer.. even the mobile phone games. Aeria are WELL KNOWN for scamming their gamers with HIGH COST currency so I really should'nt be suprised at what a mess this game is currently in, especially with a Dev.Team that can't even keep a scheduled maintenance on track.. LOL! 9 hours for a single maintenance that only fixed minor bugs/issues.. THAT happened this week by the way, and all we got from the GM's on the forums shoutbox was them calling us noobs, and saying every hour.. the game should be back online shortly.. LOL! total clueless.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												I've been playing this game quite a lot during the closed beta and I have to say I had much fun with my friends. I came here looking for a fun Free-2-Play MMORPG, and I got what I wanted. I would give it a 90% rating in the MMO category. For my group of friends it was kind of a WoW/Lineage 2 revival. Easy to get into it, fun PvP and dungeons, and I especially like the game-design and art style (even though on the tech side the game is not The Witcher III, let's face it ^^ But my laptop could run it pretty smooth in high, it looks sharp).Sure it's not revolutionary and it doesn't have a special feature that stands out, but it becomes more and more attractive and interesting as you play the game. It has all the features I was looking for, different types of PvP, a ton of dungeons to farm gear, cool mounts and pets (if you like lamas you'll love riding them in this game lol), nice crafting systems, a pretty extensive job system and the end-game content seems huge (even though I have done much myself after I hit level 60, I need a bit more time to look into it as I was having some fun in PvP for a while and put the dungeons/questing on the side).It's pretty easy to get into it even for MMORPG beginners, the interface is user friendly, and I found the learning curve well done. I felt I actually needed some time to master some skills and to start feeling powerful, which is a good thing IMO (I don't like hen its too easy). I got crushed my first few times in PvP but now I actually do quite well without spending a single penny and without having amazing skills myself. On the negative side, I would say that there is some grinding involved that can become a bit boring at some point. I don't mind farming personally, but I know some friend wanted to progress a bit faster. Yet, nothing crazy either, still in line with many other MMORPGs, especially those coming from Asia.Regarding the debate "P2W or not", it didn't felt Pay-2Win to my eyes, especially in comparison to some other Free-2-Play MMOs. Sure there is a shop, but you can get most stuff via in-game drops, via the magic egg system (cool idea for free players), or by buying in the auction house. I have some friends who spent some cash on the game to buy some mounts and costumes plus some boosts for leveling, but in PvP we were on the same level. So all good from my point of view on that side. Might consider spending if I continue to play for a while, but I don't feel forced to do so...So overall I really like the game and will continue to play for a while. It's perfect for casual MMO players but also interesting for experienced players. Found the game well balanced and not Pay-2-Win so far. A good example of what a F2P MMORPG should be!

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												I would have to start off by saying that I have not played this game nearly enough to make a really educated review - so take this with a grain of salt.My first feeling when playing this, is the same I get with every MMO these days - nothing will just ever feel as fresh and have this "wow" effect on me again, as World of Warcraft once did. At the same time though, the game is decent and fun once you get past the first standard leveling bit.The bosses in the dungeons have some cool mechanics even already early on and the group dynamics are mostly cool. The highly acclaimed "missing heal class" is a bit of an overstatement though - instead you just go and shield and redistribute HP, etc. so it is almost like healing classes.PVP is pretty fun when you find the right group to play with - a couple of different game modes you can spend your time with and I would bet that guild play should be a nice thing for end game. The whole enchanting system gives you a purpose for running dungeons to just get the last bit of extra out of your gear. Of course they sell♥♥♥♥♥♥in the shop to get an edge for these things - on the other hand though even if I am willing to spend money, I still have to farm a lot of gold in order to get the enchanting done. So the gap between players should not be that big - especially since the power curve is not as drastic (unless of course you go up against like a +12 and you are +2 with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gear)So give it a try, especially if you have some buddies that will play along with you. You can get quite far without spending money, especially when you join a guild so no real risk there.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												Ive played since day 1 OBT it was going okay until recently with pvp season 2 although it isnt a pvp based game.... however Aeria has stooped extremely low into the 'leech players for money' tactic that they allowed a instant lvl 35 boost for their new character, the warlock. In case you still decide to play level 35 can be achieved in an incredible short time. The economy has become completely broken by the cash shoppers like every other game where f2p is not f2p. Do not pvp in this game if you want your time wasted when a new seaon comes they completely wipe your gear... Anyone who puts money into this game (and tbh even playing it at this point...) is completely wasting their time. Do not fall for this scam...Do not fall for Aeria, they are a waste of what could be a reasonably good development crew.Let's not fail to mention this either...There have been multiple incidents where this have occured and not just with myself but many people who have played the game.Aeria, at least for this game that I know of, uses a SEPERATE login server and game server.Meaning whenever you login to the game of course you have to go through ANOTHER server so when the login server crashes you have 2 options...1) Wait for the servers to be fixed then get on and be told that they will compensate everyone for the login servers being down... one of two things will happen here either you get ONE of these blessings: Edun's, Njord's, and (if the problem was that huge of an occurance) Levina's (+4 Atk 2hours, +4% Def 2hours, Double EXP and Gold for 24 hours <---- rare) 2) IF you are in game then you cannot log out which of course isn't that hard to do EXCEPT when Aeria is fixing their login servers SOMEHOW they screw up the game servers also leaving you to inevitable crash while they fix the problem.After they have this problem occur they undergo a maintenance to "fix" the issue i.e. after the "fix" is done you can't login because its still broken...That's just trying to get in game and stay in game...The P2W or might as well call it P2P...Now I am completely free to play in the game yet I am still the best Stormguard in the game but... It does not stop people from judging people about their gems. Anyone who knows me in game immediately wants my help with dungeon DPS but when you go into a dungeon and have to tell 4 random morons talking about gems to shut it and watch the DPS meter only for a F2P to come out on top they get livid....EXTREMELY livid. So besides the P2W to just be complete BS for PvE the player base is rather saddening.But PvE is where the chance to "win" stops lets go to PvPAt first everything was okay people were learning and figuring things out so you could fight and in that time gather gear to keep yourself balanced with them BUT the new players were matched against the "skilled" (P2W theres no skill in opening a wallet) players its like watching a gazelle try to befriend a lion. But... it managed to get remarkable worse..As I stated earlier they released PvP Season 2 (Even the developer himself stated that it wasnt a pvp based game).Before the occurance of Season 2 GM's stated that you should quickly use your pvp currency because they would be wiped. However, they FAILED to mention anything about a PVP GEAR WIPE. So many people F2P and P2W began grinding gear in the last few moments of the first season. Just to have it completely replaced with newer higher level gear.Well you might be thinking now, "Why's he ♥♥♥♥♥ing about this? It means everyone is on fair ground." No...no it doesn't allow me to explain.( Keep in mind that all gem scalings are the same and that the next tier of gem only increase the item level that it can be slotted into.)A gem in this case lets use an Onyx a gem that is slotted into a helmet in order to increase the CRIT ACC stat from the helm.Before the math begins lets start with a helm that just has 100 Base Crit Acc a +1 Dull Onyx or Lucid Onyx would both apply this affect:          +1 Crit Acc + 4% Crit Acc (of the base stat so +4) coming out to an added +5 Now this isnt much but the items you would use in pvp have MUCH higher base stats and youre not going to be running around with anything lower than +5Now if you use a +6 you get :       +6 +26% (of base stat)If the item only has a 100 thats a messley 32 stat points big woop...Lets kick it up to the P2W's +11 Lucid jewels (no one has a +12 jewel yet but i will supply the scaling for all jewels anyway)       +11 +91% (of base stat) <--- yea thats right 91% that doubles the 100 stats to 202 but as you increase in gear of course that +11 wont double it but 91% sure about does.Now coming soon there will be a new gem the "Intermediate gem" the lucid is consider a low rank gem...   But what happens when the Intermediates come out? Gem wipe....you just spent several thousand of USD to have it thrown away wouldn't you feel smart.I will leave this with a chart of gem scaling of +1 to max +12         +1        +1 +4%        +2        +2 +6%        +3        +3 +9%        +4        +4 +13%        +5        +5 +19%        +6        +6 +26%        +7        +7 +35%        +8        +8 +46%        +9        +9 +59%        +10      +10 +74%        +11      +11 +91%    <--- highest lucid obtained so far by date of review        +12      +12 +110%  <--- highest dull obtainedNote: Dull Gems are no able to be used in items of 64 item level or higher so you must swap to lucid.Someone in +8 gear is able to 1 HIT someone in +5 or +6 and someone in +11's can one hit anyone in +9 or lower and devestate someone in +10As I said the 100 base stat was a mere example main items have stats more that quadruple that of an item that would have any 100 base stat.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												Well here goes nothing! If you're a fan of World of Wacraft and a fan of beautiful scenery, combat and more then this game is for you. At first I was skeptical to play this game since I read from the other reviews that this game just wants your money etc... when in reality that is far from the truth. Unless you want to buy cute outfits, mounts, pets, and etc... then yes you will be wasting money but yet the game already comes with tons of those that are free so unless your a compulsive shopper, you should be fine. Just like any MMORPG, you will be using the number keys to be using your spells/actions to use in combat. You also have jewels/crystals/runes to increase your armour and weapons effectively (which make you badass btw) where you can get from questing, killing monsters, and battlefield. Speaking of battlefield, it really helps. When playing battlefield with other players (PVP) you gain a crap ton of XP, Jewels for your armour and weapons (previously mentioned) and food to keep you sane. When in battlefield you also get special PVP points which you can use in the PVP Battlefield Merchant that gives you exclusive gear towards your character to make them not only look cool but be better in PVP. Leveling up is pretty fast in the game, within 5-7 minutes you'll already be level 7, once you are level 10 you can do dungeons, battlefield, and raids. Now let's get onto the pretty ugly part of the game. The textures. Suck.♥♥♥♥♥ The textures of the game look like they havent been updated since 2006 but yet the Character's, Gear, and spells look up to far with 2016-17. I feel like if they worked on those better, then you can feel a little less cringy. The second part is the FRAME RATE DROP. No matter if you have a expensive gaming computer that can run anything on your computer without lag, this game unfortunately has it SOMETIMES but most of the game is playable. Third reason, it is not a very popular game. Very few people play it (Estimated around 300-400 which is pretty low compared to other games) which if you choose to do Battlefield it can take a good 5-30min for people to actually join which is .... eh.... oh well... Overall, the game is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing amazing, I love playing it with friends and meeting new peeps everyday. :D Don't be shy, give it a try!

												So about this game.Firstly : "About the people that complain that it doesn't bring anything new" - OF COURSE IT DOESN'T BRING ANYTHING NEW BECAUSE - it's free, so there will not be any grand developement on it - but nevertheless it has an unusual allure to it that makes you want to try it.While it's not the next WOW (World of Warcraft) in the making, it definitely needs to be experienced. Many will not play it hardcore BUT it will give you something to do while you wait for the games you want to play.Secondly : NO FREE MULTIPLAYER GAME WILL HAVE SOMETHING NEW TO INTRODUCE - because it's FREE. To have something new to introduce you would have to pay for it, simple as that. Who would bother to give something new without gething something in return, let's be realistic.While it doesn't have anything new to introduce, it does have an interesting story, YES - I'm one of those who actually read the story - , while the graphics are not the NEXT GEN they aren't bad at all, good music,But there is one thing that not many multiplayer games use : IT HAS NO HEALER CLASS - which is awesome because you actually have to think about survival and buffs and worry about your health. So if you want to have an interesting adventure and do some strategic thinking while you're at it PLAY IT. It's FREE for heanve's sake.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												I downloaded this game as soon as it became available on steam because I thought it looked interesting and I wanted to play a new mmo rpg. I didnt expect to like the game as much as I do, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fantastic free to play mmo rpg. There is so much to do once you hit 60 (max level) and it continues to be a very enjoyable game. Also, there is absolutely no pay to win aspect which is fantastic seeing as its a F2P RPG. If you can get past the fact that there is gender locking (I know, its 2015 and gender locking shouldn't be a thing in RPG MMOs anymore) it is a very fun game to play. Updates every few weeks to keep the game interesting and I hope they continue to grow and improve the game. Dont get me wrong, there are a number of faults with this game but nothing to make you steer clear of atleast giving this game a try for yourself. Gender Locking is a problem, but they make up for it with decent customization. Balance between classes is a bit off, but you can make up for it with skill. PvP and Dungeons are a ton of fun especially if you are spamming them with guildies/friends. All in all good F2P RPG.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												Tried this game today. the graphics are nice and from what I could see the game play was decent. That's as far as I got.Right away I notice my FPS was capped at 60, no problem there's a setting that allows you to turn of the limitations. Then I noticed every few seconds my frames would drop from 150+ to the teens and start climbing again. so I started turning down settings. After reaching minimum setting on everything I decided to uninstall. Steady fps is a must and I can not play a game where my fps is reset to almost nothing every few seconds. I do not run top end gaming rig but an Intel i7 4790k, nVidia GTX 770 and 16 gigs of ram should be able to run a Free to Play game at max settings with 0 fps issues.I had high hopes for this game, too bad unsteady fps causing a stuttering effect had to ruin it.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												Now let's start like this, it's a decent MMO if you are looking for classics. The only problem it has is that sometimes can be glitchy, in some rare occasions which isn't that much of a problem to be honest, but it's nothing new. It's the most 'Typical' classic MMO with the rule of grinding quests and simple PVP mechanics. I like the souls system in the game, but that's the only thing that interested me in playing, but then compare the game to all other games that just recently came out or are about to go free to play like Archeage, Black Desert or Albion online, I feel these will be the games worth playing when they go free to play, Archeage has an amazing housing systme, Black Desert will have astonishing graphics and fighting mechanics and then Albion will have a very interested look at MMOs from multiple perspectives, but then when you look at EOS, It's just another MMO like any other. 5/10

content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
												This game made me bittersweet, but I will not reccomend it to other players.Simply because. It's a simple go here and get this MMO.  I'll explain why It made me bittersweet.I like pretty games. I liked the outfits, the graphics were good. I even liked the Soul part of the game. It was fairly interesting.But...The quests were the same. I did a dungeon by myself. There was no need to play with other players.The reason it made me bittersweet is because I did like the game concept. The battling was nice, but the battling threw me off because I couldn't move much. ( I was an archer.) The sidestep was literally pointless, I don't know why they bothered to put it there, but I did like the Soul stuff. How you would have wings of color on your back. I thought it was cool. So basicallyPro: Good graphics. Interesting concept with souls.  Pantie shots. >-> The battling was decent. The story was okay. Not the best. Music was decent too.Cons: Sidestepping was pointless. ( I like to move when I'm battling.) The quests were go here and get that. Basically, gathering and killing things.Even though it looks like the pros outweight the cons. The quests are the MAIN part of the game and for that. It sufferered a thumbs down for me.  Sorry Aeria. Not your best game, but it's decent if you're looking for a simple MMO.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												As a general summary of this game, the whole things is as generic as a generic MMORPG can be. Generic evil entity wants generic fantasy world to end, and generic hero player starts the game while generic war ensues with generic guards fighting generic red demon monsters. Blah blah blah, yadda yadda yadda, skip all the generic dialogue and cutscenes, blah.Look I'm going to break it down really to just the pro's and con's.Pros:- Volume slider available during cutscenes (Actually clever!)- It's 'alright' looking, graphically speaking- Strip to your underwear (Maybe it's a pro, maybe it's a con? I dunno it's up to you, I ain't judgin')- Clothing/Armour is tasteful (A little risque, but not TERA levels of skimpy.)Cons:- Combat is generic, slow, and boring.- Storyline/Plot is generic, borning, and uninteresting.- Voice acting is 'alright' I guess? Certainly by no means amazing, but not the worst I've heard.- Gender locked classes (So much for "advanced character customization")- Limited keybindings (Skill/Item/Mount bindings restricted to 1 - =, F1 - F12)- Lots of wasted space (Useless 'between zone' zones filled with useless trash mobs deisgned only to waste your time.)Needless to say that I don't reccommend this game, however that's not to say it's bad, it's just nothing special. Look, if you like generic MMORPG's, give it a shot, but don't expect anything amazing because I guarantee you won't find it. As far as PvP is concerned, I didn't bother to try it simply because I personally don't care for PvP, however if it follows suite with the rest of my experience, it's probably just as generic as you'd expect.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2015
												Great game, with the World Of Warcraft based GUI and average graphics. However what the game lacks in is what most games in whole lack in, that's captivating the player with the starter quests of the game and throwing all you can to that point of the game, leaving the rest of the main quests not exciting like saving women from beasts or searching the shops for a cute plushie. I highly recommend this TPS MMORPG game to patient people. People who can stand killing the same things over and over again, With a slight change in loot collected or loot needed to complete the quest. In the game there are a series of bugs and glitches and simple mistakes that take time out of your gameplay to abondon the quest and re-do it. For example you deleting a quest item on accedent and having to abandon it and collectit back, Although this is a player based thing, we shouldn't be aloud to delete or sell any quest item in the game, also if a bug happens during the main quest when you're half way through it... Believe me i speak from experience that it is plain annoying that you needing to spend an extra twenty muinets going through the quest and completing it again with you knowing how you could've completed the game half an hour prier.Still, i'm not hating on the game for what it is. The game is a average game with a huge helping community, without the mass spam of ingame payments.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
												 I know my play time seems low (as of this writing it shows 1.2hrs), but I assure you I played this game much while it was in beta. This game is your basic cookie-cutter-run-of-the-mill MMORPG... That is all, this game does everything just well enough to be middle of the road. It has OK graphics, OK character progression, OK sound, OK gameplay... you get the picture. Not that it's a bad game, in fact, the utter OK-ness of Echo of Soul puts me in a tight spot. I can't not recommend this title, but I also can't wholeheartedly recommend it either. So, I guess a compromise: if you are brand new to MMORPGs try this game. But, If you are a veteran MMORPG player I'd say there's nothing new to be seen here.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												Right from the bat, I knew this game was going to be a polarizing one. To begin, classes are gender-specific. If you want to play a female rogue, well tough luck. There isn't a lot of customization in character creation, so you'll find several copies of your character once you're out on the field. The graphics are nice, but it's nothing special.It's fairly easy to level up quickly, but it's also very boring. Quests are the generic "kill this many creatures," "gather this many items," or "kill creatures to gather this many items that may or may not drop." The skill tree is not extensive. This might be good for first-time MMORPG players who can better understand the simplified rundown of skillsets. But again, this brings back the con of lack of customization. A serious flaw with this game (in my opinion) is how difficult it is to earn money. This makes professions useless and expensive in the earlier levels.Like many F2P games, there is a cash shop. While the game doesn't shove the fact in your face as much as others, the fact that there are actually quests in the game that requires you to purchase an item from the cash shop just irks me. Also like many F2P games, PVP is horribly unbalanced. Some classes far outlast others in the battleground. Archers are the devil.This is just your average MMORPG. It will keep you entertained for a few hours before you get tired of the redundancy.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												I really like MMORPG games. I was actually addicted to WoW a long time ago. I've also played a lot of TERA.. in fact I have 5 or 6 toons on TERA most of them are level 40-50 and one is maxed at 65. I also have a couple toons on Riders of Icarus... one of them is maxed out on there too. Why does this matter in a review of this game??? Because I have no desire to play this game any further than the time I've already put into it. Honestly, this game is kinda boring. I made it to level 10 in like an hour. The fighting style is traditional and not action based like I'd prefer. The graphics maxed out.. are sadly pretty poor for a recent game. Texture resolutions are not anywhere near as high res as they should be for a game this old. On the other hand, the toons look pretty good. Except where the head joins the neck.. I don't like seeing that seam. Maybe it's superficial, but it drives me bonkers.The game play is just meh. Point and click or tab to target enemies like WoW. Kill so many enemies, gather so much stuff, blah blah blah. You can't sheathe your weapon, so you're just running around with it out all the time. Classes are ALL gender locked.. big boo. And your first mount is a... llama.. how original. -_- I played as a Guardian which is a female class witha giant spear. So basically you run around poking bad guys with your spear that is always out while doing your little anime run. There's also this soul power thingymabob that gives you extra powers.. but I didn't fully understand it.. because I was too bored with the game to bother reading all the dialog that explains it. Sure, there is a guy that talks to you when you use the help window, but he is boring too.And now I am bored with writing this review. So in conclusion.. this game is not for you if you like action/adventure type MMORPGs. If you are looking for entertaining games with freedom to do other things than quest.. quest... quest... go check out TERA or Riders of Icarus (just watch out on RoI, because there is a stupid ban glitch and you might get banned for 82 years like I did for no reason).

number of helpful: 35 of 67 people (52%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												EOS is a new cutesy anime style MMORPG with the classic MMO elements but a slight difference. You can relate it to WoW in terms of combat(for some part), nothing is seemingly new for such a new MMO, I will say its very well done for what it is. My long review, I hope this helps any one on edge about playing or not. Also consider it a mini basic things to know of the game.Cash shop? Yes. P2W? I wouldn't say yes or no it this. Everything in game can be purchased with gold through the market from other players, some cash shop items through the "magic egg system", and others from events. Basically anything from the cash shop can be gotten with gold,  and at a much, much slower and less probable rate via Magic Lamps(purchased with eggs)PvP? Yes Battlegrounds, Arena,  and its well done to a point. A player over level 10 may join the BG's and its a great way to level. Gems can be used on Equipment to improve your stats as well. Anything over +5 means you will need a Safeguard(use magic eggs, cash shop, Lamps(random), market, to get) to ensure that your gems do not break when you upgrade them, but no guarentee they will upgrade. This system can greatly unbalance PvP but as long as you do your share of the work you will be rewarded, win or lose. I cannot say for that you are guarenteed rewards in arena with a lose though as I have yet to do that. Its a lot of fun but you may also find yourself wanting to bash your head off the wall at some of the players.Guild Battles?Yes! Open world guild pvp makes it a bit harder if you are lower level and new to the game. However avoiding a hostile guild is best until you are familiar and comfortable with the game and your class.Guilds can compete in Valhalaa, where guilds will compete to kill a daily spawn boss for amazing rewards that will benefit your guild. Dungeons? Yes! My favourite part of this game is the level 60 dungeons. The game does start you small, giving you regular and heroic soloable dungeons to do starting from level 10 until 60! This is a great way to learn boss fights and mechanics until you can get to level 60 and begin heroic party dungeons. The game holds your hand though in the fights and will tell you what to do and when to do it, so long as you can read! Epic PvE armor will drop at random during each level 60 party dungeon. There is a weekly limit cap on how many of each specific dungeon you can do, starting at 4. You can increase this with dungeon tickets x 2(bought from market, magic eggs, found in lamps) or reset one of your uses with 1 ticket. You will get 30 gold per dungeon I believe. 10gish per boss. Its great for earning gold and then you can afford to upgrade gems or buy cool things this way!Raids? Coming Soon~Profesions? Yes, you will be able to choose 2 hobbies and 1 profession. The 2 hobbies are Cooking and Soul Processing. Both are important and should always be learned right away. The 3 Professions are Resource Collector, Jeweler, Alchemist. Unfortunately there is no armor, weapon or bag crafting but those come easy enough. I would have loved to see FISHING Q.QCooking: Energy and Satiety play a big role in buffing your attack and HP. Energy is used when you use any skill! Satiety fades slowly with time and will determine your hunger level. If you are full you cannot eat any more food to increase your energy, energy is what specifically increases your attack and HP. You can either use a Digestant(Cash shop item, market item, lamps.) to lower your satiety, or wait it out. Digestants can also be obtained from questing in the highest level questing zone.I feel like I should shut up at some point so maybe now. Overall its a newer game in a old school MMORPG style, great for killing time and probably getting really in to. You will find nothing new here but if you love Anime and MMO's then this just might be your game. At least until Blade & Soul or Black Desert. . .

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												This is an okay game, not great though. I didn't have to play it long to see that it wants your money, and is buggy. I'm sure the bugs will be cleared up at some point, but I'm being dropped out of the game every ten minutes. I tried other servers to see if the dropping was just the server I was on, but it was all of them. I did like that it gave you mounts, but I wish that we are able to fight on them, or even gather plants or items from them instead of just the 'faster' transport that they allow.  The hot keys are difficult to use and changing them doesn't help much. I also wish that you didn't have to click the target (Even pressing tab doesn't help much) to be able to attack rather than just face and be able to attack.The story is okay for as far as I am able to get (again, keep getting kicked off the game for no reason) so that is a point in their favor.  If you like rpg's then I say try it, it is okay and you'll never know if you'll like it until you try it.
