content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												I usually do not write reviews, but when I saw some of the criticism directd at this game I felt I had to. I have been playing EOS since late in the Beta (got lucky on FB and got a free Betakey) and so far I really like it! Sure it is not the re-invention of the wheel but it gets quite a bit of stuff just right... Want to do PVE? ...Check!Dungeons? ...Check!Gear? ...Check!Professions? ...Check!Want to do PVP?  ...Check!Battlefields? ...Check!Arena?  ...Check!Is all of that perfect? Heck no but it is a nice all around package. Some things should be fixed (stunlock in PVP, addition of Raids...) and then it would even better.Now since this game is F2P the item shop is obviously something that needs to be carefully looked at, but really there is nothing too crazy there, mostly cosmetic stuff (costumes and the like) -  the only thing I did not like was the Enhancement Booster that makes crafting a bit easier, but really it's not by that much and I do not spent on stuff like that anyways...So would I recommend this game? Yes! It is an easy to get into MMO that is more on the casual side (though Dungeons can get a bit tricky due to the absence of a healer)... Give it a try!

content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												Played my fair share of these types of games and while it has some things I like, it's pretty bland. I came to this game out of pure boredom. Let us just say, it didn't fix my problem. Classes are gender/race locked, visuals are pretty horrid. While the character models seem decent, the terrain/environment is ugly as ♥♥♥♥. Leveling is generic and boring, though I don't expect any more from an mmo tbh. Quest leveling is hard to escape. You unlock PvP at level 10. You can level via battlegrounds if you like, though it isn't well balanced atm and you're GOING to get wrecked, especially as a Rogue. So far my PvP experience has been rough, with players constantly shouting to do things a certain way and to "gtfo". None of this being aimed at me as far as I know but honestly the PvP is pretty easy to grasp. From the modes i've played it's just capping♥♥♥♥♥♥ I've only played for about 4 hours so I can't really say anything about much else. So far, I think most should pass on this, unless you're insanely bored, or don't have a better mmo to play. There are many f2p games out there that are much better.   EDIT: I would also like to point out that the battle system, isn't anything great. It's your same old tab target and stand still system. As I said before, there are MANY other mmo's that do this better.*EDIT: As much as I bash Tera, it is WAY better than this.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												I read so many bad reviews about the game either from the press or just here so it took me so long to hop on and try it. I started playing out of boredom when heavensward didn't seem to cut it for me and i'm so happy i did because i'm glad.This game takes every single good mmorpg system and just delivers it in a very polished and tweaked maner. Small details here and there. It is very standard and very expected. Quest hubs, typical class's with dual specs, instances, etc etc. The hole thing is very common but yet very well done and tweaked to be very enjoyable.I really like this game and so far i didn't find any cons to it yet. I will maybe find some bad things to say about it along the way or at max level, but so far it is the most enjoyable mmo i played since a very long time and i like it.Nothing fancy like wow killer, or super inovation for the sake of inovation, just a very solid mmorpg like they used to make back in the days with some tweaks and flavor that makes the difference.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
To add some context first for my opinion:I played or tried many MMORPGs, few of them for a bit longer time. However, all of them grew boring rather quickly, so I do not particularly like MMOs, mainly because of the slow progression / grind and the very static worlds, as there can be no big changes resulting from your actions, as the next player must have the same content available.I am also not interested in PvP, so I cannot say anything about this here.The playtime recorded by Steam might be rather low, when you read this, but I played the game for a longer time before, as it was released on Aeria Games' own website some time before the Steam release.GAMEPLAYI gave Echo of Soul a fair try, as with those other games. In the end I must say, that I am positively surprised.The PvE balancing and Quest goals are done in a way, that does not halt your progression through the game. The flow feels like Diablo 3 i.e. you keep moving through the game without being forced to stop and grind in one area.They also use the phasing system that games like World of Warcraft used, so that the world around you actually is able to change in response to completed quests. For example, early in the game you arrive at a town, which is on fire and overrun by enemies. After you save it, the world changes and the town is normal again, functioning as a regular in-game hub with merchants and players etc.VISUALSThe graphics and design are nothing new or spectacular, but EOS does look very nice and inviting. In addition it has it's own charm, as you can create quite extravagant characters. You have a variety of unusual hair and skin colors to select from and the size slider has a big range as well. It is not as expansive as some other games, but definitely good enough to not be limiting.CASH SHOPI read in other reviews, that the game feels Pay to Win for them. Looking at the items available on the Cash Shop, I can understand this notion, as some items seem quite powerful. But in all the time I played, I never actually felt compelled to buy anything there, as the game's balancing does not feel, like I would really need any of them. The only thing that really is of interest, are the extended bags, as there is quite some loot to carry around after some time of play. Even the standard mounts, of which you get one very early in the game, are sufficient, so you do not need to buy a better one.TECHNICALI did not encounter any serious lag or other technical issues. The game ran smooth and stable for me. There was only some lags on the release day, a couple of weeks ago, but that is completely normal for an MMO. I read that some people's Antivirus software is giving warnings, but this also happens with many online games, as the Anti-Hack tools can be seen as false positives by those Antivirus tools. I personally did not have this issue.BOTTOM LINEEcho of Soul is nothing new or extravagant. It is competent, solid and the actual gameplay is done in a way that it is entertaining without any grind. It might not be made for the hardcore players or those that want a great PvP game. But if you are looking for a good time in PvE, Echo of Soul is definitely worth a try.TL;DR:Overall I can recommend it. Good PvE, no grind, Cash Shop can be ignored without problems. No lags or other technical issues that I saw.

												So, I didn't put alot of time into the game, fair enough, but if I have to put 40+ hours into a game before it is worth playing, there is an issue anyways. Not enough people get that, but that is a different issue entirely.Truth is I didn't have an issue with the graphics, or the cash shop, or the classes, it's the world, too small of zones, too many load screens. there is an area right after you begin that has a forest, and its just a lot of small rooms with a wall of trees surrounding it. The game itself is ok enough, it is very generic and bland, but the constant kill three mobs move to the next room to turn in quest, rinse and repeat is almost insulting.

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												just wanted to share my opinion on this gamei´ve played wow for over 9 years, was a couple of years in a progress hardcore raid guild and played in 2v2, 3v3 and 5v5 with a rating over 2k easily..in my wow years i paused often and played a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of other mmorpgs and to tell you the truth..this is the first after wow that i think i can spent a couple of years with. the graphics is a typical anime-esquee style but not as cheesy as others and after a couple of minutes you get used to it if you never played games with this kind of graphicsit has typical runes and jewel stuff to upgrade your equip and you can awaken your items to shot the "hidden potential" which are similar to random enchantments i guessthe quest system is symple and easy to understand with nice direction and distance tips and changing markings on the map when the monster you need to hunt movesbut the most awesome thing about this is the actual combat..as a wow "veteran" i loved the challenge in pve, dodging, moving and calculating everything to get the most dps or whatever and this game is one of the few that has this kind of combat systemanother big plus is the soul system which is something fresh and new for me: monsters drop chaos souls which can be purified to one of four different "soulds" and those souls act as special skills that ingrease stats for a short period of time and are pretty awesome to kill bosses in solo dungeons (havent tried 5 man dungeons yet) and i must admit that the difficulty of those solo dungeons arent to be underestimated and are really fun and challengingoverall i have to say that this game is ♥♥♥♥ING AWESOME and you should try it..i dont know about the p2w part because im not 60 yet and tested the end content but you can get mystical eggs or something which is similar to ap ( the real money currency) but anyway...it is a great mmo and im probably going to play it for a long time and you should test for yourself if you like it or not :D

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												I played during the CBT and now in OBT - up to lvl 60 with war protector - Lxsd on EU-serversEoS is very polished for a F2P, graphics aren't astonishing but pretty, classes and skills offer a variety of gameplay and builds very satisfying. The UI is very user friendly and compiles a lot of cool features (e.g. inventory manager). Early levels a bit boring, the game really starts around lvl 50. The progression until then is a grinding & quests or PVP battlegrounds.The soul and crafting systems are also interesting and featuring a lot of cooperation aspects (coop refining, complementary jobs). They are maybe too simple and straightforward (small amount of materials, recipes), do not offer a lot of different specs but at least they give useful items.The cash-shop offers a lot of stuff, like mounts, vanity items and boosters. The costumes aren't coming with any statistic, only vanity. Some boosters are available (4% atk/def, 30% pvp marks, +100% xp/gold) - the rest is mostly convenience such as character slots, bags, and other crap. Most items are tradable and available for gold at the AH, so people who don't spend can still access almost every item item that could break the balance - EoS honeypots you to spend some cash but is not P2W imo - i bought a founder's pack to access CBT and get the limited edition mount but always got cash items vs. gold at the AH since then, including safegards. Pros:- Pretty graphics (except for these horrible ground textures :s), interesting lore- Variety of classes & gameplays- Good UI - user friendly- Interesting Crafting system + coop soul refining- All cash items tradable, therefore the AH is full of cheap cash items for Gold- Guild wars and other coop features- High level content & raids - bad♥♥♥♥♥sword for warriorsCons:- Instanced areas and channels (i'm not a fan of this system)- Gender-locked classes- Lack of low level coop dungeons (35/50 - adding a lvl 20 coop dungeon would be cool)- Polished but generic game- Lack of pvp battlegroundsIt's free and it's honestly pretty packed for a F2P, there is far worst crap on Steam atm - definitely worth the try.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Echo of Souls is a beatifull made MMORPG with alot to describe but ill only do a shortreview now.It has good graphics, an interesting storyline, multiple well designed pre-set Classes andalot of Quests for the player to do if you believ the info over 1000+ quests for you to enjoy :3The Community is how it first seems based on about 3 languages english, german and afew french playersbut still friendly and not too mature.You have 60 lvl to climb and making your Soulkeeper look awesome on the go with many different typesof armor and weapons.The PvP is sadly nothing for beginners since the matchmaking puts lvl 15 players against lvl 40+ but the game balances that with a little passive that gives players under a specific lvl a hp and attack boost so they can actually fight back.Since the publisher is Aeria games the cash shop is sadly a bit expensive as seen on other aeria games but its not neededsince theres no real dmg buff or anything like that it is mostly just outfits and pets even though you get a free 1week pet at the beginning with a mail. This has been the review and i hope it helped but you guysshould make yourself an experience in the game itself so i recommend it to others who love putting in time tocreate a strong character designed to become a grea Soulkeeper!

content:
Posted: August 10, 2015
												This is the first real MMO that I've gotten into.PROS:-Fun, easy to understand gameplay-Hours of gameplay-LLAMA MOUNTS-Pets-Lots of Quests to help you level up and progress in the story *DO EVERY QUEST YOU CAN*-Fun dugeons-You can play with other people-Refrences to a lot of things (Check Quest titles)-Good looking scenery and graphics-IT'S FREECONS-Gender locked classes-Not much character customization, but the body changing options that there are can be funny-Needs more unique Quests, it's always "Kill the monster(s)" or "Collect the item(s)", aside from some Story Quests-Sometimes I tend to forget about Soul Purification---------------------------------------------------------------------To all the people who say that the game is hard, or that they keep dying in Dungeons, I've gone solo the entire game and so far and it has been very easy for me. Yes, even the Party bosses. And no, I have NOT paid any real money to get better items in the game. Cranky's Advice: GIT GUD

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												If you like playing games like Neverwinter, Terra, WoW or Guild wars, then this game is good for you to have some variation in your games or just to play someting new.The combat system is very convenient and very simular to neverwinter, WoW and GW.Key features of the game which I like are:  -PvP and PvE with lots of dungeons.                                                                      -Crafting and professions.                                                                      -Socketing system.                                                                      -Choosing different skill pathways.Things I like less but are imo not that important: -Lack of character customization.                                                                                - No real healers: only tank, dps or debuffing.I haven't seen anything like pay to win advantages, more paying for unique outfits or pets.Overal, this game is above average for a free to play mmorpg and I can definitely recommend this game for players who want something new or something for variation.

number of helpful: 12 of 25 people (48%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Played before it was on steam.(ALOT)This Game in a Nutshell.Good Game ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Graphics ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Fps 52-62 on a high end rig which is atrocious considering the sub par engine and the graphics in general.But the Gameplay is really fluent and just leaves so many opportunities to personalize skills / movement to your advantage.50% of the Skills can be cancelled which exponentially increases your DPS in general but  especially in pvp.PVE Gameplay is decent , story is nothing new  not good ... but not bad either.But the thing when it comes to pvp is the same as in every other , cashers .... cashers everywhere ...BUT FEAR NOT , i haven't paid 0.00€ in my playtime of 970hours (raptr approves) and i♥♥♥♥♥♥on cashers about 80% of the time.The thing is when you can pay for something , you can usually craft it which requires more effort but will be rewarded.Or you trade good drops against the reallife currency , long words short story = play the game and you will be rewarded.Even if they have 10% more damage you can still outsmart them when it comes to mechanics.And if you think the game will be boring after 60 , ye that might be partially true BUT who said you have to stick with 1 character? Level others , change servers , make new accounts . That isn't a big deal and is usually no problem unless you don't enjoy the game.I personally enjoy the game , and of course i do recommend this game to everyone who enjoys MMORPGS and isn't afraid to put an enormous amount of time into it.Aye , forgot 1 thing. content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												I finally got Echo of Soul to work and wasn't too impressed. I only played one class up to level 9 to at least give it a chance, but it didn't hold out.Playing to GameIn order to actually play this game, I downloaded it through Steam, only to have to download it again from the game's actual website. After transfering some files, the game could be played through Steam. If you're interested in checking this game out for yourself, a walkthrough on how to play it through Steam can be found at the following link. Just click on "Getting EoS to work through Steam" on the right hand side.http://steamcommunity.com/app/290140#scrollTop=1900Character "Creation"First, is the classes. I'm not overly fond of classes after some of the other mmo's I've played where you can use any (or most) of the skills, equipment, etc. If you don't care whether a game has classes or not, then go ahead and disregard this one, it's just a personal thing for me.Second, classes are gender locked. Every warrior is a big, muscular dude with a big sword. Every rouge is a lithe dude who looks like a kid. Every mage is a little girl. You can customize their hair, eyes, face, the colors, and some sizes, and that's all free (at least at creation. I don't know if you can change it later or not). To me, this is picking a character to play and customizing their appearance a little.QuestsTo be completely honest, I skipped over the dialouge portion of the quests, so I don't have any story other than cutscenes and bosses. I found the quests to be lackluster. Even the MMO's I do like have some of this, but the quests seemed to be sending me to talk to someone, kill some monster, or get something. In addition, each quest was only one task long. While this does get you to the reward faster, it's not as challenging and, in my opinion, is just too simple. I faced, and defeated, two bosses before I was level 8, and that was solo. (that could possibly be a balancing issue, or it could just be simplicity itself).New, better equipment for your class is also given away as quest rewards. While this is useful in saving money and not having to bother with shops (I didn't even look at those), it further simplifies the game. If you ever have to use a shop, it'd probably be to sell things and clean out your inventory. Everything you need is given to you when you need it.SkillsAgain, I only played one class, and not for very long, so I don't have all of the details on this. What I did notice is that your skills are automatically learned and hotkeyed as you level. This does remove the hassle of picking out skills each level, but it also removes the ability to customize your class and play the way you like. Then again, you could just not use the skills you don't care for, but why have them anyway? I'm fine with getting preset skills in other RPG's, but I prefer to customize my MMO characters, whether it's their appearance, gender, or skills.Cash ShopMany free to play mmo's have this, so I'm not going to complain about it too much. They do have to make money somehow. However, there is at least one quest, albeit optional, where you are to buy something from the cash shop. You are able to abandon the quest, but there'll always be a marker in the second town for a quest you haven't done, because you haven't paid for it.GraphicsThe graphics were good, I won't complain about those. Characters and terrain are beautiful, monsters are appropirately hideous. This is a good 3D environment, with good character models. I experienced no lag at any point while I was playing. (Don't ask what my settings were at, I never checked.) The graphics may actually be the only thing I actually like about this game.ConclusionI wasn't very impressed as the game took too much effort to be able to work for a rather generic, simple mmorpg. There are some elements that are unique, but the overall gameplay reminds me of just about every other mmo I've played without the challenges. I didn't browse any shops, pvp, or anything like that. I had no need to check a shop for new equipment, and I've never been overly fond of pvp. If you'd like to give it a try yourself, the link to get it to work through steam is provided above and again below. Just click "Getting EoS to work through Steam" on your right.http://steamcommunity.com/app/290140#scrollTop=1900

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												I've only been playing for not even a day and yet I'm already enthralled in the game. Probably what sets this apart is the fact that it's fresh, clean, and crisp. It's not some cheap knock-off. The GUI and gameplay is very user friendly so you don't have to spend an hour and a half trying to figure out where the hell is what you're looking for. The beginning of the game is very flowing and doesn't suddenly drop a lot of concepts onto you rapidly like a lot of others do. It is a game that is simple enough for gamers who are new to the MMO to easily get into while still having enough to draw experianced players in. In short, these are the reasons to give it a shot.- It's brand new. Join the fun early and play as new content develops instead of trying to catch up.- It's for friggen free! Who doesn't love free?- The graphics and art is of good quality and yet not too much where it causes lag. Even my ordinary laptop can run it smoothly at 17 FPS.- Character customization. You can add/subtract height in body and legs which allows you to freely control your size as well as your face. Make it look like you if you want.- It has a great GUI that's easy to grasp even for new MMO players.- The community is great. I haven't seen any super "hard core" gamers that bash the newer casual players yet. If anything, they're a life saver. If someone of a signifigantly higher level tells you to do something, do it. You'll thank them later. Also because it's a new game, there are loads of new players that you can partner up with right at the beginning.- Minx had recently done a playthrough with the game on Youtube to give you an idea of what it looks like.-The skills have good synergy. They actually put in skills that compliment eachother if you play smart.- Each class branches off into two sub-classes early in the game. A warrior for example can branch early in the game to be either a protector which is a defence-heavy class to tank for friends, or a beserker to go all out and chop enemies into two. Two players of the same class does not nessisarily mean they play in the same way.Note that there are areas specifically designed for you to grind in, and as such is highly recommended. The goblin camp is the first place to grind in and you'll find that soon.One thing I think the developers could've done was make a male and female avatar for each class. Currently, there are five classes; two of which are male and the other three are female. As a man, it was dissapointing to see my favorite playstyle (mage) be only usable with a female avatar. I am sure it is the same way for women who love playing as warriors or rouges. For men who would rather not play as women, we're stuck with either playing as a warrior or a rouge. I'd very much like to see a male and female for each class evenly. Another thing is gaving to set up an Aria account but you'll run into that in the launcher and it's fairly quick and easy. Other than that, it's a great game that's freash out of the gates and just waiting for new content.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
												I will give a personal experience of this MMO.First off, the graphics, in my opinion, were very good. Animation looked nice, presented well. If I were to give any criticism to the aspect of looks, it would be the UI. A lot of MMO's suffer a clutter of menus, chat boxes, maps, lists, and this one is no real exception. But with a bit of tinkering, you can get your layout a bit less cluttered, so it isn't a real problem.Second, the system. I feel this is an average system. Much of what I saw didn't surprise me, but it worked well enough. It's in fact simpler than a lot of MMO's, when it comes to upgrading equipment, purchasing and selling on the marketplace, etc. You'll get a hang of it quite quickly with the right intelligence.Combat was actually pretty well constructed, however, I do feel that fighting isn't very satisfying. Is it balanced? I feel in both PVP and PVE, the devs constructed it well enough to avoid too much inbalance. BUT, there is a catch that comes later... (see final paragraphs)Third, is it a fun MMO? I would say yes, but only to a point. The quests, as I expected going into this game, repeated themselves. A lot. I mean... a lot. Each time you wish to get to a new exciting area, there's this connecting path that will look the same, and will take you a good half hour to get through. The rewards for questing and adventuring are dull. Very dull. The best you'll get is a choice of either weapon A or weapon B. You get the one tailored to your Class skill tree. Done. Next repeat quest, ahoy! Rinse and repeat.At level 60 (cap) this game changes dramatically. If you were to go into PVP at level 60 with your new shiny level 60 equipment, expect to get MASSACERED. All of a sudden, you feel very weak. You have all these things to do, all the PVE grinding quests, dungeons, hunting grounds, farming, that it's all just too much. This is where I stopped playing.I tried to be a level 60, I tried. I even looked up a guide on HOW TO PLAY A LVL 60. The fact I had to do this, in my opinion, brought my rating for this game to 'eenope'. Frankly, it requires so much devotion of time, so much effort, getting shouted at by other players about doing things wrong. It isn't worth the dungeons, wings, and shiny equipment. Just don't bother. It'll suck the life out of you.In conclusion, this game can be fun, for a time. But I do not recommend it's worth anymore than a test play.

												I was very skeptical at first when I started playing the game. I read the mixed reviews and stayed away from the game at first. However, I finally decided to give it a try since I really didn't have any other game to play. I must say that I am thoroughly enjoying the game and will be continuing to play this game for a while. I think it was the Battlefield feature that got me hooked. It is honestly alot of fun!!I also do like the fact that the quests in the game aren't like Super Grinds, basically do a few things in an area and you are onto the next. I have played previous games where some quests requires hours to complete, so far I have been moving throught the quests extremely fast.overall, I am impressed and would recommend this game.

Controls are pants, you've got your "AWSD" like normal... but no Q or E... unlike a "normal" mmo A and D do what Q and E normally do and the only way to turn your camara is hold down right mouse and moving it. content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												"Play exactly how you want, when you want!" Somewhere at level 16 there is a quest that makes you collect bear♥♥♥♥♥♥ This pretty much sums up the whole game for me. There are only two types of quests in the entire game; 1. Kill X number of identical enemies, 2. Collect X number of an item.The story is bland and tedious and player interaction is minimal. The combat is buttonbashing, because the skills have no  specific visuals or effect other than a minor difference in damage output. Also, it's pretty hard to get killed, except for dungeons, so no real challenges there either.BUT, for a free game, it's still pretty polished. The cash shop offers vanity items and temp buffs, so it's not really pay2win. Just try it out, if you're into sub-par casual MMO's.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												TL, DR: Best RPG MMO on the current market.Hi guys,I was searching for a long time a 'good old style' MMO RPG since the Guild Wars 1 has been abandoned. All of the others caused disappointment. But this is just as an RPG MMO should be, nothing special, but everything fit.Pros:-good combat system, skill based, so you have to use your brain, but thanks for the popping up Q and E skills it is still dinamic.-a lot of very simple but very good solution, like: you can change the graphics settings just by two clicks (literaly), for example in PVE area you keep it on max, but when you join PVP you can choose a lower setting to eliminate the unnecessary shining things and get extra FPS when needed.-although the questes are quite tipical, but some NPC are really funny, if you read the text of the questes.-graphics is good while it is still running well on older PCs too.-Set for European mind: Odin, Gehenna,... the anime feeling is very small.-good crafting system but you are not forced to craft if you do not want: in this case you can choose the resource gatherer profession and get money on it.-according to my experience it is NOT pay to win.-community is helpful and they tipically can behave on an adult wayCons:-too fast respawn, sometimes you have not even the chance to get the loot and the mob is already there again.-lack of dedicated healer profession-sex locked preofessions, but it is not a big problem, professions generally fit for the sex (male warrior, female sorceress,...)Overall, it's obvious that it has been created by an MMO-experienced team.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												This game....Aethestically its pleasing not anime themed. Movement is point and click. The skill system is decently thought out, and is a plus in this game. The combat is pretty fun. You get a mount early on in the game which is nice. A problem with this game is the game progression. Each map there is a little exit portal at the end. If you are targeted by an enemy you are not allowed to leave that section of the map. So for one are there are like 8 sections that you need to progress through and after you go through a portal there is a super fast mini load. As you progress in the game its mainly kill and collect quests. Through quests you do not need to worry about getting new equipment or potions/scrolls to restore health/mana.Another problem is that there are no stores or areas you can buy/sell stuff. All the loot gets accumulated in your inventory and there is nowhere to sell or buy stuff.  This entire time I have been playing there has only been one spot to sell/buy stuff and that was the beginning. More problems incoming(O.O)...the classes are race and genderlocked. I do not think there are multiple races but the classes are genderlocked. I chose a gaurdian class and it was locked to be a female. This game is not really a game I would continuously play. What stopped me from playing more is that there are no towns/merchants to sell my loot. So I have to pick and choose what to keep in my inventory.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												Play Dualist. EOS is an average MMORPG. It got the combat good but essentially you will manage with only 2-3 attacks or tactics. You get a fiesta of those attacks, way too much to remember what they do and for what. The missions gets repetitive very fast after level 19-20, and it's missing variety. The main quest gets completely lost after level 20...the game should keep getting the attention of the players with more in-game cutscenes but it completely vanished or became too far apart. You might continue for the leveling but certainly not for the story at that point. Equipments can be upgraded with jewel and runes outside the profession system, which is nice since the profession system feels totally useless and a pain to process. It feels like the profession was done after the main game to some extend...I don't know...I tried it for a good while but couldn't see the point of it so I decided to invest zero time in it. I sell the ingredients and it has zero impact into the game. So not the strongest of system. Another system is the one related to the Souls snatchel. Processing them give you a buff of something. I process the souls because there is a counter of totals of souls but you can completely skip the buff since it's impact in combats is somewhat minimal. It's fun to find dungeons that are solo, but that area of exploration is far and between. You get some pets that gets the items for you (very nice) and a mount that isn't fast enough. I suppose you can buy better (unless Aria games doesn't lock your account because your Paypal email is different then your account email-fix after 3 days). The graphics are fine by me, some better then the others. I say the textures, the characters and water are very nice. The modeling of the levels can be very basic at times, and most of the time you switch from 2-3 small areas, to a larger one. This can be annoying in terms of loading time, but they are not too long. I won't say it's the best game out there but I would give it a 60%.Update: I got a bug that was  kicking me out of the game always at the same location and same place. This happenned after a recent update, search internet, etc... I tried to get support and even post on a forum on steam: Failed all the way. So I keep my review the same way but be warn.

												This games is amazing but it has it's pros and cons.Pros:-The game is Free to Play you can get the best gear by just playing so it's not a P2W as some of you state. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												A lot of the negative reviews I have been reading are all to do with launch issues. Fair enough, this MMORPG will not appeal to everybody but none do (including WoW). This is a F2P game and by no means pay to win. Of course it is possible to level faster and gain weapons/armour sooner if you pay (as I have) but it is just as easy to unlock it. Crafters will be rewarded much more than those who pay and the auction house is a great way of getting some cheap gear.If you are looking for a great, free game to sink a couple of hundred hours into then this is one to try.Also, the only reason that I don't have much game time is because I do not play this game via Steam!

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												I have to say this has to be one of the best games I've played in a long time. I love it and it isn't as annoying to level up in as compared to games like Lord of the Rings Online. The way it is set up is simple and comfortable to use and in my opinion blows most games away. There are a lot of quests to do and they are pretty simple and short to do compared to quests in games like RuneScape that can take hours even days to complete.Echo of Souls reminds me a lot of the game Rapelz which is a game I played a lot before getting a new computer and was never able to find again. It is easy to get engrossed into this game and hard to walk away from. This MMORPG is definately one I'd recommened to new gamers as well as veteran gamers. The graphics are impressive and the game runs smoothly. The only problem I can see is the fact that the 5 choices of charector tipes are gender locked, but that doesn't really decrease how much I like this game.I'd like to thank the people who made it for bringing such an awesome game into existance.

content:

												Nothing special, it's another generic MMO but totally playable and with unique storyline. >PROS:-Graphics are not bad.-Unique storyline.-Very intuitive for any mmo player (P was for character, I for inventory, K for skills, L for quests, etc like Aion and such.)-Easy to adapt and mess around with the settings.-I've found not much grinding, but i'm still on low levels so I can't really tell.-Rewards for consecutive logins.-Mechanics are just like most MMOs.>CONS:-Quests are dull and repetitive.-Gender-locked classes.-Very anime-like characters (Personal opinion but I believe mmos should fit everyone).-By default you are put on the Highest settings.-Offers no exploration of the surroundings.-Shows you alot of content but you'll be stuck to click and cast an enemy the whole game.I rate this game 6/10 simply because I like the overall aspect and story. It has no innovation whatsoever, looks like any other MMO, nothing special in it, there are better F2P MMOs out there, only check this one out if you dislike grinding and like western lores.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												This is a great F2P game. The graphics are nice, the gameplay feels fresh, and the world is pretty large.The game isn't an easy walk in the park; with solo-dungeons being nearly impossible at the level they are unlocked (2 lvls above unlock is recomended).While there is a cash store, it doesn't feel as if it intrudes upon the game in a signifigant way compared to other games. Lots of quests keep the player busy, searching for new gear and lands to explore. The PVP is great for a new F2P game, with players being able to enter the battlefield at lvl 10. More content is being developed, and I intend to keep playing this game. A great RPG with professions, lots of gear, wide variety of enemies, numerous dungeons, periodic boss spawns in the open world, guild and guild wars, and battlefields make this a game worth the time to check out. And all of it is FREE!

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												A lot of the negative reviews I have been reading are all to do with launch issues. Fair enough, this MMORPG will not appeal to everybody but none do (including WoW). This is a F2P game and by no means pay to win. Of course it is possible to level faster and gain weapons/armour sooner if you pay (as I have) but it is just as easy to unlock it. Crafters will be rewarded much more than those who pay and the auction house is a great way of getting some cheap gear.If you are looking for a great, free game to sink a couple of hundred hours into then this is one to try.Also, the only reason that I don't have much game time is because I do not play this game via Steam!

content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												As you can see I only have about 10 hours playtime on Echo of Soul. I personally really enjoy this game, though admittedly it's nothing different or unique. However, I do recommend it:Pros+Large and friendly population (And it seems to be growing from what early players have told me)+Rewarding combat and there is a need to roll to dodge attacks being charged up by enemies.+Rewarding 15vs15 PvP from level 10+ (You play pvp with players from level 10 - 60 all in one game. Everyones stats are scaled to level 60 to balance out the gameplay.)+A very large world, especially for a new game, with currently 0 expansions or level cap raises.+Pretty game, the graphics are dated but it's still visually gorgeous.+Levelling isn't too slow or too fast. I reached level 25 in 10 hours. (Remember the level cap is 60)+Group dungeons from level 35+.+Innovative and interesting soul collection system.+Professions+Can choose one of two paths for each class at level 10. (Beserker or Protector Warrior for example)Cons-Rather generic, nothing we haven't seen before. (Though for some reason I enjoy this game a lot more than many similar titles.)-No innovative classes.-Gender locked classes.If you are looking for a fun, polished and rewarding MMORPG with a large, active community, I highly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
												This game is what you'd expect out of an MMO. I was just looking for something to play casually while spacing out and this works just fine. I created a few characters just to mess with the character creator and it's not terrible, there are definitely games with a lot more limited character creator. I did notice though not a lot of people take advantage of what flexibility you do have since everyone seems to be pink skinned and white haired. I guess that even when you give people some room for creativity they tend to just all look the same which makes it hard to tell people apart. That's not the game's fault though. It ran perfectly fine on my computer in fact I wish there were higher settings. This game doesn't require a fast computer so mine was definitely overkill. I don't mind the gender lock since I don't care if I'm playing male or female. So far I've found myself leveling up my Rogue more than the others. I would like to find a game that has a really friendly and welcoming community but there never seems to be one. People just play the game and rarely interact and the fact that people would need the game to force them to group up just shows that there's no point in anti-social people playing MMOS. There are so many MMOS out there now-a-days though that the chance of finding enough people that play the same game regularly enough to be able to enjoy coming back and questing together is very unlikely. So as a solo player, the game is nice looking, runs smoothly, very stable and a good time waster. Just make sure you disable any programs running in the background that may be causing the anti-hack program to go off and interrupt your gameplay. It's a simple fix. Just make sure you have nothing running in the background.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2015
												I am honestly surprised by this game, while it doesn't exactly shine in graphics or feel the most modern and polished mmo I have played. I find myself enjoying it a lot. Especially the PvP battlefields, they are fast paced generally capture point driven and combat is relatively balanced regardless of your level. (annoying stunlock still occurs, but that's every mmo I've ever played) It's free, there is a cash shop but I've found absolutely no need to actually use it, it's completely voluntary the way it is set up, and lets be honest if you put more than 20 hours into a game you should chip a few bucks the way of the company that provided it. Another feature I like is the ability to solo dungeons, it's doable as pretty much any class and any level. You can get all the gear in the game and never party up if that's the way you want to do things. You can also of course party up, the strangest mechanic there is there is no dedicated healer class in this game. It takes some getting used to. They compensate for that by making potions, revives, and heal scrolls easily and cheaply obtainable at the npc in game shops. I could go on for awhile but despite a lot of complaining and bad reviews I found myself considering this a good game, and will likely give it even more time, and maybe even spend a few bucks on that cash shop just to show my appreciation. Usually these korean cross over mmo's aren't very enjoyable, but this one reminds me of what WoW used to be before they turned it into the lowest common denominator crap that it is now. I highly suggest giving the game a few days and 20-40 levels to make an impression on you. If you can see past it not having the greatest graphics I'm pretty sure you'll find yourself enjoying it. Even though the server populations aren't very high right now, battlefield pvp and dungeon searches usually take only a minute or two and the more the merrier.

content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
												It's pretty good.  I wish the classes could be either male or female, but besides that the character design has a good amount of choices.  I really like the levelling system too.  I enjoy having to decide which two abilities I can take and which one I can do without at each "branch."  Customization is important and too many games ignore it.  I have only made it to level 48 so far, but the quests are well written and engage you in the history of the world - if you take your time to read them.  9/10 as far as free to play games go :D

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
												First I gotta say that I enjoy the game and like playing it.  Nothing new or special really but that doesn't detract from playing the game for me which is why I recommend it.  The issues I have with the game don't break the game and make it unplayable and are more just annoyances.My only real issues with the game are that your limited on inventory space if you don't want to pay irl cash for the large bags to increase your space.  You can get 5 extra bags that have 6 slots on in them from questing but any more then that and you gotta buy them and you don't really make in game currency all that fast or at least I haven't.My other issue is with the professions.  You can have 2 secondary professions which are cooking and soul expert, but you can only have one of the 3 main professions. So you can get resource gathering which as it sounds you just gather resourses and do nothing with them.  The other two are alchemy and jewel crafting.  Note that the issue is that without resourse gathering you can't get the items you would need for the other two professions.  So you can't work on the crafting professions without help and the gathering one juse leaves you with a bunch of resources you can't do anything with besides sell them since you don't have the inventory or stash space to hold onto them for when you replace the gathering profession with a crafting one.Like I said I still enjoy the game and enjoy playing it but those points just bother me and make the main professions not worth your time to do unless you have a friend who can do the gathering portion for you or you can gather resources for a friend to use.  If not go with the gathering profession and then sell your mats to other users.

You can have 2 secondary professions which are cooking and soul expert, but you can only have one of the 3 main professions. So you can get resource gathering which as it sounds you just gather resourses and do nothing with them.  The other two are alchemy and jewel crafting.  Note that the issue is that without resourse gathering you can't get the items you would need for the other two professions.  So you can't work on the crafting professions without help and the gathering one juse leaves you with a bunch of resources you can't do anything with besides sell them since you don't have the inventory or stash space to hold onto them for when you replace the gathering profession with a crafting one.Like I said I still enjoy the game and enjoy playing it but those points just bother me and make the main professions not worth your time to do unless you have a friend who can do the gathering portion for you or you can gather resources for a friend to use.  If not go with the gathering profession and then sell your mats to other users.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												So after playing to lvl 15 (I know its not that much but it gave me a taste)I have to say that this is a good solid MMORPG, does it do anything exotic or new? well if you consider removing all the annoying SH*T that most ofther MMORPGS have like "Kill 20 wolves but somehow only loot 3 wolf fangs that you need for a quest" nah nah nah, in EOS you kill 20 wolves for a quest, they damn right drop 20 sets of teeth for you to pick up (hyperbole but you get the idea). This RPG is great for new and old players alike, the swords are lovingly bigger than Guts "Dragonslayer" and the armor is flashy and stylish like in games like TERA. Id give it overall a 7.5/10, it would have scored 9/10 if not for the games one little problem. this is that all the classes are gender bound, meaning you you can only be a male warrior and rogue, while every other class is female. im sure this is great if the devs thought they were going to attract a ton of female gamers and guys that love playing as women (eww but whatever floats your boat) but in most MMORPGS i try and roll a male wizard or something similar, but in this game decided to try out a warrior for the sole reason that its one of the few male classes, which in an age of games giving you huge control over customization and making your character unique seems like a HUGE oversight. but thats just my take on thing.overall 7.5/10

												It's pretty good.  I wish the classes could be either male or female, but besides that the character design has a good amount of choices.  I really like the levelling system too.  I enjoy having to decide which two abilities I can take and which one I can do without at each "branch."  Customization is important and too many games ignore it.  I have only made it to level 48 so far, but the quests are well written and engage you in the history of the world - if you take your time to read them.  9/10 as far as free to play games go :D

												A completely standard korean "F2P" MMORPG. Only slightly prettier...I have sampled what can be sampled of this oevre and there is nothing spectacular or innovative about this game. I'm not sure how much the game picks itself up towards the end and when you reach the level cap but honestly, what more can there be? utterly generic and inordinately dull. so...why am i still playing? i keep thinking there must be something here and i'm going to find it. i mean, there has to be some good things? the pvp is fun, if you are into pvp, but even the really good mmo's have good pvp, so...i don't know, if you are curious you should at least give it a try, however if you enjoy a deep story and interesting quests...stay faaar away from this title. I'm still recommending it because it is nice looking and i enjoy the art and the music, and as i stated above, i'm still playing it myself in order to find those redeeming features.

												i played this game to level 28. I decided i like it and wanted to purchase a mount and some new bags. First mistake i made was wanted to purchase anything in this game. One you can supposely only purchase one item at a time during your first time purchase from them. Ok i can take that no problem right. So i say "ok, i go ahead and try to at least purchase the mount".I do transaction and it goes through and i receive a e-mail confirmations how sweet. I was still online with my game on. So thinking i dont see anything added to the game. Then i thinking like most game you must log then relog back in to see the results.Their hence comes the problem i get locked out of my account cant play or reach them. I try to reach their customer service but cant since my account is now block. Which means your password wont work to reach them.I have never ever gone through this purchasing items in any game i played and i played a ton. I have purchased most my games from steam. I feel steam should remove games from this game company. They obviously don't know how to run a company or out to steal from steam customers. If you are already playing this game "Be very warned do not purchase anything from this company."I have made contact with the support team. I like to thank them for quick response they have reactivated my account. I did receive the ap points i bought. I bought the item's i wanted and now playing with them. I had about giving up on this game and company. But thier quick action has shown me the do care about their players and will try to fix your problems if you patient enough. I do like the game and hope others do play it. I just wanted to let other players known not to fear buying items and getting temp ban.  If it does happen dont worry send in a ticket and it will be fix they will just have you send in a new password and then log in as normal. It took them one day and thats probably cause it was sunday it happen to me.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												This game....Aethestically its pleasing not anime themed. Movement is point and click. The skill system is decently thought out, and is a plus in this game. The combat is pretty fun. You get a mount early on in the game which is nice. A problem with this game is the game progression. Each map there is a little exit portal at the end. If you are targeted by an enemy you are not allowed to leave that section of the map. So for one are there are like 8 sections that you need to progress through and after you go through a portal there is a super fast mini load. As you progress in the game its mainly kill and collect quests. Through quests you do not need to worry about getting new equipment or potions/scrolls to restore health/mana.Another problem is that there are no stores or areas you can buy/sell stuff. All the loot gets accumulated in your inventory and there is nowhere to sell or buy stuff.  This entire time I have been playing there has only been one spot to sell/buy stuff and that was the beginning. More problems incoming(O.O)...the classes are race and genderlocked. I do not think there are multiple races but the classes are genderlocked. I chose a gaurdian class and it was locked to be a female. This game is not really a game I would continuously play. What stopped me from playing more is that there are no towns/merchants to sell my loot. So I have to pick and choose what to keep in my inventory.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
 For all those not wanting to read through my review... This game is 8/10....  ALSO PLEASE SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN TO THE BOTTOM TO READ SOME EASY LEVELING TIPS AND MAKIGN MONEY IN GAME  Now anyone who sees this game would easily say that this is a watered-down version of FF14,  however  , I beg to differ.Echo of Soul (EOS) is a game that targets to make its own take on things. Beautiful worlds, great mechanics/ animations, and hours of addicting fun. The game is quite difficult proving that there are no healing roles whatsoever, so keeping a watch on your health bar is an absolute must. This game isn't so hard in the leveling process, as grinding is not really required. You don't rake up xp as much as you do grinding helpless creeps for hours but rather doing quests in a timely manner. This was done in order to make the player feel rewarded for their quests and accomplished for doing something to progress the game.  seriously though, do the quests   NO PAY TO WIN This game doesnt require pay to win at all. It was setup so that the player gets often rewarded for leveling up, questing, earning achievements,a nd also winning in pvp matches and gamemodes. The store only offers "outfits" that are costumes for your characters and you can wear on them. These outfits have no effect but change only the outer appearance of what your character is wearing. All the armor can be found in game :) ROLES/GAME The roles/classes each have their own unique abilities and feel to playing that you can easily tell each other apart. However, each class has 2 specific paths in which you can take in order to level your skills, giving the player the freedom to play how they want when they want.Speaking of which, there are jewels that players can "inlay" into their equipment that give mighty buffs. Combining these jewels, if you have more than one, will boost the effects given to that jewel if it will be laid into the  specific piece of equipment.  confusing i know, but its easy to understand when you see  In terms of  freedom  the roles are gender locked, so you cant be a body-building girl warriror  sad i know. DUNGEON/PVP This has a great dungeon and pvp aspect in the game that give both high risk and reward. If in any case you may die in a dungeon or in the world you would face a durability loss on equipment and would have to repair. PVP is different however in which you can die however many times you want and get either a consolation prize or a victory prize after the match. This has smart matching so you can do wahetevr you want while you wait.   Now for the tips  I cant stress this enough but just enjoy all the game for what it is. For easy levling do the daily quests for the pvp. You need to play 2 games (win or loss) and there. You get basically a level and lots of money. Money is a bit difficult to aqcuire in the game, but is super easy to buy and sell as everything, and i mean EVERYTHING is 1 silver. (excluding all the rare stuff).From completing the pvp you get either a consoloation jewelery box or a victory jewelery box depending if you lost or won. After open and i suggest you save those jewels to create greater ranking jewels. Selling a +5 dull ruby on the marketplace you can make an easy 75 gold.I think those are good odds considering that 1,000 silver make 1 gold LOLAll in all, a great game worth playing. Enjoy!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												I will catalog this review the best I can to get straight to the point in each topic I feel a person should know before they play this game. Overall I want to focus less on my experience on other MMO's I have played and tell you why I continue to play this one.1)Leveling-So as I said in my very brief Intro, I am going to get straight to the point and not fluff anything. Somethings about this game could be better, but most things work very well as are, and "If its not broken dont fix it". Leveling in this game is hands down my least fave part of playing. I have 3 level 60 characters(Max Level) and I havn't enjoyed leveling a single one. I still love this game and heres why. This games content is tailored to level 60 characters, and leveling is a very repetative yet still fairly easy process if you just quest. Quest over and over. Doing battlefields will give you experience to level but only will make you level faster than questing if you have close to a 70% win rate. I say rush to max level as fast as you can. 2)Guilds-Many players have a different opinion on who to make friends with (or not make friends with) and why. For many players they join a guild because it's mainly there nationality(Brazil Im talking to you). There are many guilds to choose from, and many guilds choose to fight monsters while many choose to fight players. I prefer to fight players so I picked a pvp guild and I still get to do just as many raids or dungeons as I would have had I not picked a pvp guild. Choose one early in the game to ask questions and make friends. Being in a guild is very rewarding and often helps you learn things the easy way rather than playing the game "in the dark".3)Gold becomes a thing of desire once you hit level 60. Gold is not needed in any way before level 60 if its your first character. If its your second character or later it can help you to get better gems which make leveling faster, but the game drops enough of them naturally you wont need to worry about it your first run through. Gold is your vehicle to get what you desire. EVERYTHING in this game that effects combat can be purchased with gold. You will have the fastest access to making gold in level 60 raids and dungeons. Or buy and sell goods on the market place if you study it before hand.4)Gems-Gems are extra items that attach to a players gear to make a player stronger(extra stats). They are a very important part of the game, but often highly over glorified. As a player with 3 level 60's I often play in pvp "gemless" and still compete just fine for MVP. This game isn't that hard if you always are trying to learn what you can do better in a given situation. Gems are luxury!!! Now dont ignore them 100%, they can be a great way to make gold, and a great investment into becoming a stronger player. Far too many players blame their gems as the reason they are losing, when more importantly people with very good gems MOST of the time have better gems because they are better players, although I have beaten many players in flat 1v1 situations having worse gems. I have average gems because i refuse to spend money on this game. Hear that? Never spent a single penny. 5)Dungeons-Dungeons before level 60 are very important and let me tell you what to do and what not to do. Before level 60 do the dungeons just to learn the in game mechanics on bosses, becuase the dungeons you see before level 60(or the bosses) you WILL see again. Focus more on improving as a player in dungeons, than the gear. Going through the same dungeon before level 60 is a flat waste of time once you learn the mechanics. Yes it will give you good gear, but I argue your gear would be better if you spend that same time questing into higher levels over farming a dungeon. NOW AT LEVEL 60, the dungeons are good for gear, and will start to bring a lot of gold. They drop gems and become a true test to your understanding of the game. Do not be upset if people lose their tempers with you in a level 60 dungeon. A lot of players are so used to the dungeons you may be new too, that they dont understand why you are still learning the bosses. My best peice of advise, let good friends or guild members take you to your first lv 60 dungeons to help you grow.6)Events-Now this game like many MMO's has holiday events. The events in this game so far are more community builders than actual content events, although some events still bring exciting content into view. I argue this is something that Echo of Soul needs more focus on(Maybe through studying World of Warcraft events) But the EOS team has shown willingness to make this a larger part of the game, and i think much more is to come.7)Reward Drops-Hands Down my least fave part of this game. Most items in this game are worth 1 silver to sell to a vendor. Yes, 1 silver.... Now, I will not focus on that, as much as what Im about to tell you. There is no world rare drop system as in other very fun MMO's. This is something I hope very dearly will enter this game. We need to be able to go into a raid with our friends or guild hoping to get a SPECIAL MOUNT or special item that is ONLY available in that spot. Just by creating a system where some high value items drop very rarely, it creates a passion for players and a great enjoyment. A strong rare drop system allows people to actually feel rewarded for their time OUTSIDE of the personal satisfaction of completing a challenge. I love being challenged as much as the next person, but when you already know you are smart enough to figure them out eventually, a rare drop system keeps it very entertaining and exciting.8)Battleground-I have covered this a small amount already. Overall its just another way to test yourself. If you find yourself blaming your gems because you die, or your weak gear, it has partial truth. As a player who has been in a new players shoes, I still owned the noobs. Some people can mentally handle the learning curve that will come your way, and many run to excuses. Do the best you can and have fun! Try to learn and enjoy. There is 2 battlefields(3rd if you count Valhalla aka-guild war). Dont make excuses, if you arnt doing well ask others how they play your class in pvp.9)PAY TO WIN?-FLAT ANSWER NO! This game is 100% NOT PAY TO WIN. You may ask me why I feel that way, well heres point number 1, I have spent not a single amount of any type of real life currency on this game. I still can get beat, but as an experienced player of this game, I find when i get beat it was a result of my own failure of knowledge. Some players are going to be stronger than you, maybe their class "counters" your class. Yes crazy idea I know. When you see a situation like this in battle its best to not fight the 1v1 you think you will lose. I know many good players who wont win a lot of 1v1's. They are viewed as good players because they know when they do and dont have the advantage, and sometimes having your team with greater numbers is what it takes. Dont listen to anyone who says this game is Pay to Win, its a scapegoat and quite frankly, very poor excuse. This game can make your growth faster if you choose to pay, but with that still comes a lot of risk. I know a lot of people who have spent money and not gotten any stronger for it. Think outside of the box and learn the game and the answers will come to you.10)Last Thought-I find this game to be the closest video game to a much loved anime called SAO. Now that has nothing to do with my love of this game. I personally enjoy testing myself, which this game helps me do. And i love the vast majority of the community. Players here can be mean just like anywhere else, but I have made friendships and I enjoy the time I spend playing. This game far surpasses the time I could spend watching TV or playing another video game.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												Good game, no tedious quests, because the main part of the game is party dungeoing and pvping, guild worldpvp and raids which have pvp features!It's fun so far, sure there are a few cons. One of them is matchmaking on PvP. You can go PvP from level 10! But, be ready to go against 10-55 players. Which means that the team that has most low leved people will loose!Because at lower levels in PvP you have less skills and less damage.Wish it could go like 10-15, 16-21, 22-26 etc etc, but nah, it's all together and it makes really tedious times in PvP, lazy high level players do much less than low leveled players, which is pathetic. So your only hope is leveling up and have fun in PvP and higher levels!You still can be useful in PvP at early levels but 50% of what a high lvl can do, example is that you cannot 1v1 a lvl 25+ as lvl 15. Unless they have half their hp off. :)Overall i reccomend this game, hopefully they will add more options to matchmaking but questing wasn't tiring and im looking forward to the dungeons and pvp raids. It's still fresh and has a way to go.Don't listen to most of the reviews as they complain about the game being from AeriaGames, don't get me wrong, I don't like AeriaGames either but it has the best monitization system from AeriaGames. Nothing is P2W so far. And hope it stays that way. It doesn't take long to level to 60 casually.Be aware, it's like any other mmo out there, there is NO mmorpg that can feel as refreshing as your first ever mmorpg game, if it catches your attention for a while, good. If not, there's nothing to complain about because every mmorpg has done things everyone else did. :)Have fun playing.EU - Yggdrasil, Normie.

												This game made me so bored, about 45 minutes into the game, I made an attempt to talk to my family. As I thought that would be a better time. It advertises strength gain via enemy souls, However the only thing the souls are worth in the little amount I played were small buffs that lasted around 15s with a 2m cooldown, I thought that rather than passives, Actual leveling could be replaced by the idea of souls. Making the stuff you kill, strengthen different attributes, which would have probably kept me playing longer honestly. The art style was boring, and the only positive thing I can say for what little I played, Was that it had a decent amount of character customization when creating the characters. Its nothing new, Industry standard i guess.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
												So I hate this game. The reasons why are as follows:1. You cannot live up to your own promises regarding your "Advanced" Character customization. Especially when you gender lock classes and you are too lazy to do hair physics for the majority of the 11 hairstyles you have available.2. Peers have informed me that this game contains little to no worthwhile content before level 60.For anyone looking for something that might be worth your time, try Arche Age. It might have flaws such as bugs and the economy (and of course the dreaded housing system) plus the quite obvious pay2win aspects including secondary currency and Patron status. But even then, the gameplay is dynamic and the classes are more versatile than any other game I've played. The Character customization is also absolutely STUNNING. It is very very well done with a PLETHORA of different options.Either way, this game is boring and not worth the space on my Harddrive. I reccomend looking somewhere else if you wanted a good MMORPG.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13
												Echo Of soul is one of the better games of this studio. Sadly the servers are pretty dead.Why you ask? the publisher, the ingame store is questionable and honestly while the game is not P2W like their other games this game lacks quality. It is your standard mmo to kill 10 mobs here and there with a few dungeons that require no tactic. In many ways you would not believe this game came out in 2015. But if you enjoy an easy game and want to spend some time killing mobs, getting good looking armor this is your game.In my opinion your better off buying Elder scrolls online, Gw2 when they are on sale for 10 Euro's, if you want a really good free to play experience Wildstar is the way to go, echos of soul could learn a lot from them.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												I have played this game since early beta and have around 900 hours put into the game. I am currently 6/8  109 pvp items which currently makes the the best geared pvp sorc on any server outside of asia. I love this games pvp. But there is just not much to it. 2 battlegrounds and an arena system. My team got up to 1700 team rating and would spend hours in que just to get 1 match in becuase the developers didnt know how to set up a competent arena mmr system. The PVE is okay but nothing groundbreaking and there is not much to it at the moment. The serious lack of content has unfortunately caused me to steer people away from this game. I may change my stance if the next pvp patch greatly improves the state of things but I am not holding my breath. I currently have about 150 hours into skyforge and am loving the game so far. I would suggest giving that game a try over echo of soul as of september 15th 2015.-Skinnie ( requiem )

The game is litteraly not as P2W as it used to and the game feels so much better. Though the game is gender locked, that shouldn't be the issue why your not playing Echo Of Soul, the game is fun both solo or with groups while doing dungeons and raids.  I haven't tried the PVP but i heard it's bad, though everyone has their own opinons and i will be trying myself to see if it is actually good or bad.To be honest, i hated it because others did but when i tried it myself i fell in love.  Just a tip, you should always try a game for yourself and don't hate a game just because others hate it, and that goes the same for liking a game, don't like it because others like it you don't have to if you don't want to.    Echo Of Soul is a fun MMORPG for beginners and veterans alike though some fetch quest and genderlock is included, bypassing that it's a decent MMORPG you should try out! ^-^(I won't be giving a number rating on this game, mostly because i feel everyone game doesn't deserve to be determined as good or bad by a few numbers.)

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												I have played this game since early beta and have around 900 hours put into the game. I am currently 6/8  109 pvp items which currently makes the the best geared pvp sorc on any server outside of asia. I love this games pvp. But there is just not much to it. 2 battlegrounds and an arena system. My team got up to 1700 team rating and would spend hours in que just to get 1 match in becuase the developers didnt know how to set up a competent arena mmr system. The PVE is okay but nothing groundbreaking and there is not much to it at the moment. The serious lack of content has unfortunately caused me to steer people away from this game. I may change my stance if the next pvp patch greatly improves the state of things but I am not holding my breath. I currently have about 150 hours into skyforge and am loving the game so far. I would suggest giving that game a try over echo of soul as of september 15th 2015.-Skinnie ( requiem )

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												One of the best ways to describe this is:"Imagine if Dragon Nest were less cartoony."I'll talk a little about what I've seen so far.Character Designs aren't original - in fact, they all look like they've come from other places. The Warrior is straight up Garen from League of Legends, for instance. The sorceress is an Elin from TERA (which is dangerous, since the game already has TERA-style graphics), etc.In the hour plus that I've played so far, I have literally not seen another player speak - ONLY gold sellers.The tutorial isn't so much a "Here's a crafted situation, not utilize X mechanic to learn it," and is actually just "You've hit the play button, here are all the mechanics up front. Go forth and die."Now, some of the mechanics are cool, but it's basically all been done before.Which means you can play this game without devoting yourself to yet another F2P P2W MMO by simply opting to instead play an MMO like RIFT or something.Don't get me wrong, the game looks kind of nice, but you won't find anything really unique or special here.I will play for a few more hours to check up on content farther in and promise to edit this review should anything really warrant it, but from what I've seen of beta and now actual time in-game, I wouldn't recommend this. And believe me that I say that assuming you were a close, personal friend of mine.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Not only is this game genderlocked for classes, but it's character locked. I'm so disapointed when mmos that seem good are like this. Warning to those who'd like to play it.I can't see it as a "best MMO" if it has genderlock, ever since I started playing mmo's in the early 2000 I've enjoyed countless good mmo's without having an arbitrary pointless restriction on class gender. It really ruins the experience for a lot of people when an mmo restricts what gender one can play with a clas. And this one takes it even further by restricting the type of person you can be, for example, you can only be a burly warrior, not a lean one, or a sexualized little girl and not a tall young adult woman.I do accept a game in which one race has one genderlock on a class for lore purposes, but the way this game does it just makes it worse for a lot of people and diversity without improving ANYTHING.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												I am writing this review while playing the game.When I saw the game was like Tera I was really worried but what the heck, could be good.Downloaded game, Launched it, Nothing happend. Went into task manager and force ended launcher, launched it agan and got lunch. Came back and launcher was up. Launcher said was loading patch, I opened warowl's livesteam, took 20 mins to load patch. When I created an account an error about the custom browser came up everytime it changed(more of an annoyance).Game loaded fine, Loaded in windowed mode which was nice. only 1 server and it's not that active. Logged into server and created a character, laggy while switching between characters. The classes are gender AND race locked. This I was confused about but it is a new game so whatever. Created my character, There is no bald hairdo(why????) and very limited to the creation. I know the games creation doesn't matter but some people care about it. Especially hardcore MMO players do. Also the character naming doesn't allow spaces or periods.Loaded character, the opening clip was pretty good. After it ended the first thing I see if login rewards, this is nice. Movement feels like WoW or Swtor, which is hold right click then attack with number keys only. Combat is a big sluggish but I am playing a rogue so it is a given. The UI is a bit in your face which is slightly annoying. The minimap could be smaller aswell as the toobar. Combat like i said is sluggish, after playing for about 20 minutes i've gotten a bit used to it but it is still hard to get used to. playing some more and I can see myself playing this longer if I could get used to the combat.To sum it all up:Pros:Combat system is very much like other popular MMOS but the abilites are strange for me.Does not require a very powerful PC to run.Classes are straight forward.Small game download.Daily rewards.Cons:Character creation is VERY limited.The ingame tutorial does not help very much.Only 1 server.Very much like Tera.UI is too big.If you are a casual MMO player this game would be fun, If you play many MMOS and are competitive in them. I would wait atleast a year to get into it. The game lacks many competitive scenarios and it was only released a few months ago on steam. I give it a 7/10.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												Echo of Soul is an MMORPG that I have been stuck on for awhile now. The game is addictive! The game has amazing graphics, cool combat mechanics, beautiful scenery, cool-looking characters and of course a world of wonder and mystery to dive into! I'd say this is by far the best MMORPG that I've ever played! Never played WoW or LoL but I can bet that they are not as good or on par with Echo of Soul. The game is near-perfect! There are a few flaws in the game but nothing fundamentally killing its play value. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who likes good MMORPGs and tactical real-time strategy games.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
												An honest review:The game is pretty good except that I don't like a few things.1 , no Healing classthey give you scrolls u put on a hot bar and basically anyone can heal with a cool down timer.2 . The chat system sucks. You can't server chat or yell without buying or winning a loud speaker n which you can then server chat or yell and it could be costy if you continue to use em up.3 . You can't run and cast4. Unless you find an active guild with active players as you are leveling , the game feels like a solo player game. 5. Instances....instances everwhere....kinda like guild wars where you have to zone instance from one area to another.... yeah...6. The graphics are pretty solid, I like the graphics.7 . The game is fun to play , the questing is very easy, very easy to navigate from quest to quest. 8 . The character customization is not that great but it's just good enough to make you cteate a unique look.9 . Crafting kinda sucks , its not that great.10 . The game offers nothing better than other MMO's , in fact its just about as basic as you can get with an MMO... but still over 100 hours in and I am still enjoying it even though I hate some things as mentioned above.
