number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												(this is all based on solo runs, no guild involved because I have no plan to join any)Good point.. Free to play, no monthly sub or anything.Easy to level if you follow quests. Hardly any grind needed and Solo friendly if you are loner like myself *evil grin*Not much there to spend real money. Unless you grind for end game gear (e.g buying Safeguard for gem enchant etc.).. There is absolutely no real cash needed to spend. Also you can buy them with in-game currency too (if someone sell what you need). Costume? you can forget that because nothing looks nice.Bad Point..Tab targetting, skill spamming.. like some MMO. Certain boss makes you move around but most of battle does not need to move around at all.Running errand again and again.. if you quit "quest based MMO" just for that, too bad you have to do it again in here. Easy to level but it is slow and tedious.. Eventhough quests helps you level, there are just too many useless quests to my point of view.. Could have cut down some to help speed up the progress.No matter where, gold sellers are present in game and seems like Aeria isn't doing much to stop them (they says update to prevent them is coming but feels like adding words to chat filter isn't going to do much), time will tell I guess.Only 5 classes. Also class is gender locked. Some people might hate for it.Customization is.. too generic. Nothing much to look at. All you can do is pick parts and done with it. Plus characters does not have idle animation, they just stand there like stick. But for unknown reason.. NPC, pet and mount have it.Fantastic illustration but in-game graphics is below average when compare it to TERA and FFXIV even at highest setting. Good for low end system, but looks rough on high end system.Uninspiring music selection. Yawn.Everything gets expensive from Level 60+. Money making till evel 59 is quite limited but once you made to 60, everything you have gathered become garbage and need start stock up from scratch with items that have hefty price tag.Overall..I'd say this game ends when you get to level 60. Getting there might be fun, but everything from 60 is just grind fest for gearing up and too expensive to keep it going.Good enough for slow play but not a nice way to keep players who are made to level cap with current game system. Might be enjoyable for casual play, but not really recommend for long time play.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												Don't let my Steam playtime fool you, I've played this game for approximately 80 hours in total, with 2 x lvl 70 toons. Leveling is quick and easy on this game. The quests are varied and don't feel too grindy even though they are the usual 'Run here and fetch this' or 'Kill 5 mobs for drops' but because you're never asked to kill too many mobs per quest, it feels varied and like you're constantly moving on to discover new areas.However, once you hit lvl 70 the game becomes a huge grindfest. You have to grind solo dungeons 30 times a week to get a chance at purple gear. If dungeons aren't your thing, you have the pleasure of killing 150 normal mobs and 50 elite mobs per day to get Chrome tokens to exchange for gear. It gets old really fast.It's ironic that this game is called Echo of Soul because it lacks so much soul and personality. You tab and click/button mash through your skills all the while feeling slightly disconnected from your toon.The only good thing I will say about EOS is that they have done a great job with dungeon bosses. You have to pay attention to mechanics and dodge attacks, making each boss kill feel rewarding in end.I'd only recommend this game for beginner MMO players because it is so easy to pick up and learn to play, but after that, move on to something with more depth that you will truly enjoy.

												Never wrote a review before but had to write one for this game. So if you haven't watched any videos on the game play.. its a quest fest until lvl 60. 												This game has many great features ranging from the graphics to the community. The PvP system is ok and the PvE is pretty good. The PvP system could be less random on the gameplay but all players are close to equally balanced when it comes to  fighting a lvl 60 with a lvl 15 though perks of gear and etc. give major boosts to those who can't access them but I suppose thats the point of that aspect. The PvE needs a little more action for mobs to fight back rather then a simple AI. It should be more complex I think as they are easily overpowered at low levels. BUT the big reason why I enjoy this game is because its not only an MMORPG but its diffrent from ones that I've played.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
												An honest review:The game is pretty good except that I don't like a few things.1 , no Healing classthey give you scrolls u put on a hot bar and basically anyone can heal with a cool down timer.2 . The chat system sucks. You can't server chat or yell without buying or winning a loud speaker n which you can then server chat or yell and it could be costy if you continue to use em up.3 . You can't run and cast4. Unless you find an active guild with active players as you are leveling , the game feels like a solo player game. 5. Instances....instances everwhere....kinda like guild wars where you have to zone instance from one area to another.... yeah...6. The graphics are pretty solid, I like the graphics.7 . The game is fun to play , the questing is very easy, very easy to navigate from quest to quest. 8 . The character customization is not that great but it's just good enough to make you cteate a unique look.9 . Crafting kinda sucks , its not that great.10 . The game offers nothing better than other MMO's , in fact its just about as basic as you can get with an MMO... but still over 100 hours in and I am still enjoying it even though I hate some things as mentioned above.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												I usually don't like games like these, but this one has good graphics and the gameplay is fairly easy to understand. It doesn't require a monthly payment which is nice and the quests are basic and easy to get to, along with traveling.Edit: I've played this game for awhile now and I've tried other MMORPGs and this one is still at the top of the list. The combat and movement is easy and simple, even if you're using a mousepad (its quite harder though, but its still optional). Movement with the mouse is very easy and you're able to zoom out to see more around you.There are co-op, single, and multiplayer dungeons.Once you reach level 60 you can buy some bad♥♥♥♥♥armor to get your HP from 2k all the way up to 13k, probably more! I wondered why everyone was kicking my♥♥♥♥♥when I joined in on a battlefield game with 500 HP and noob armor..The quests are easy to complete and don't take much time, it WILL however take a lot of time out of your day when you do quest after quest. The co-op and party quests have labels for a reason. As I said before, traveling is very easy and so is currency. Traveling only costs 1 silver. When you start off, items are usually worth 1 silver. Save up enough silver and you get yourself 1 gold, which you can then use to buy nicer items later on in the game.That's so much to read I know. But in my opinion, its a great game. I'm surprised that it works so well on my ♥♥♥♥♥♥ computer.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												Better targeting system than Terra and you can keep better control of the camera without having it go all over the place. I like the variety of character types although  as a female gamer I dont like the gender restrictions on two of them; why cant there be girl Warlocks and bladewielders? Its a fun RPG game  with nice graphics, especially if you have played all the rest and dont want to go back to side scrolling browser games. Game starts out simple enough  and the wardrobe changes when you pick up some kinds of new armor are kind of nice on most character types, the holiday events are fun, and there is a huge world to explore. Ranger or Gaurdian is easiest but if you prefer a challenge try a Mage. Cons: -After about level 25 it can be easy to get lost! After putting about 3 characters though the game to level 50 I finally learned my way around. If you dont follow the NPC's directions carefully it is easy to get turned around and miss a piece of equipment or a storyline, and the in game map and teleportation could use more explanation. They do mark some of your unsolved quests down but you have to tab through the maps to teleport or go back to where you have been.-There are hidden quests like killing all the special bosses you may never know about until an experience player points it out. And the crafting aspect takes a lot of pack space.-Its hard to get decent armor unless you PVP or know someone who can for you in the arena. Otherwise you will spend hours in what I call the monster pits trading tokens for better armor. Without decent armor and weapons and leveling the game will get very frustrating.-After level 50 it can get boring. While there are seeminly limitless settings and tons of levels, killing monsters over and over and keeping track of all the NPCs can give you a headache and get boring.-Lack of good guilds. As with any MMO it is really hard to find a good guild that will last more than a few months and you end up playing alone. There is also a lot of cashing loot that can make play uneaven.Verdict: Nice game to play for a while even if you dont finish it.

Posted: September 8, 2015
												This game has many great features ranging from the graphics to the community. The PvP system is ok and the PvE is pretty good. The PvP system could be less random on the gameplay but all players are close to equally balanced when it comes to  fighting a lvl 60 with a lvl 15 though perks of gear and etc. give major boosts to those who can't access them but I suppose thats the point of that aspect. The PvE needs a little more action for mobs to fight back rather then a simple AI. It should be more complex I think as they are easily overpowered at low levels. BUT the big reason why I enjoy this game is because its not only an MMORPG but its diffrent from ones that I've played.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												(this is all based on solo runs, no guild involved because I have no plan to join any)Good point.. Free to play, no monthly sub or anything.Easy to level if you follow quests. Hardly any grind needed and Solo friendly if you are loner like myself *evil grin*Not much there to spend real money. Unless you grind for end game gear (e.g buying Safeguard for gem enchant etc.).. There is absolutely no real cash needed to spend. Also you can buy them with in-game currency too (if someone sell what you need). Costume? you can forget that because nothing looks nice.Bad Point..Tab targetting, skill spamming.. like some MMO. Certain boss makes you move around but most of battle does not need to move around at all.Running errand again and again.. if you quit "quest based MMO" just for that, too bad you have to do it again in here. Easy to level but it is slow and tedious.. Eventhough quests helps you level, there are just too many useless quests to my point of view.. Could have cut down some to help speed up the progress.No matter where, gold sellers are present in game and seems like Aeria isn't doing much to stop them (they says update to prevent them is coming but feels like adding words to chat filter isn't going to do much), time will tell I guess.Only 5 classes. Also class is gender locked. Some people might hate for it.Customization is.. too generic. Nothing much to look at. All you can do is pick parts and done with it. Plus characters does not have idle animation, they just stand there like stick. But for unknown reason.. NPC, pet and mount have it.Fantastic illustration but in-game graphics is below average when compare it to TERA and FFXIV even at highest setting. Good for low end system, but looks rough on high end system.Uninspiring music selection. Yawn.Everything gets expensive from Level 60+. Money making till evel 59 is quite limited but once you made to 60, everything you have gathered become garbage and need start stock up from scratch with items that have hefty price tag.Overall..I'd say this game ends when you get to level 60. Getting there might be fun, but everything from 60 is just grind fest for gearing up and too expensive to keep it going.Good enough for slow play but not a nice way to keep players who are made to level cap with current game system. Might be enjoyable for casual play, but not really recommend for long time play.

content:
Posted: February 28
												Please note my time on steam is in correct, i played this before it came to steam. Echo of Soul, when i first loaded it up I thought i was going to get a nice, pretty anime stylestic MMORPG type game that would be different then the others, NOPE. I was wronged, it was the SAME. EXACT. THING. It feels like World of Warcraft & Guild Wars mushed into one game. **PROS**Free To Play - This is and WAS the only reason why I played it, if this had a price tag on it i wouldn't even play this game, it's not worth it Graphics - They're okay, they look nice, the skills on the magi look nice and cool, melee classes look the same as every other mmorpg out there**CONS**PAY TO WIN BIG TIME!!!!!!! - This game is extremely pay to win, the shop in game offers you gear and other types of upgrades and gemstones for money in real life, No MMORPG should be a F2P P2W type of game, this feels like other games i've played numerous times. Gender Locked Classes?? - I don't know if it's just me, but I'm a guy, And I like to play both female and male characters, and you're genderlocked if you are playing an archer, or a rogue, PvP - PvP is♥♥♥♥♥ literal♥♥♥♥♥ If you're playing a rogue you will win, rogue is the most BROKEN AND ABUSRD CLASS TO PLAY, If you want to level up faster PLAY PVP and PLAY A ROGUE, because you will NOT do anything else as any other class, if a rogue spots you as any other class you will get wrecked harder then you can mash your face on your keyboard, the rogue has 3 to 4 skills that are Crowd Control, why the ***k would you give a class 4 CC skills? And make every other class just absoulute garbage. Leveling up - If you thought World of Warcraft had a grind, be prepared for a grind 3 times longer then that, in WoW you at least get gear to give you 10% bonus EXP per kill and quest, up to a max of 70%, this game you don't get sh!t, you get nothing, the grind is horrendous and you must play PvP to level up the fastest, Over all, just steer clear of this money pit and give your money to guildwars 2 or Blizzard, this game sucks, hard as nuts.
